In my new home, setup went through without an issue, but now the app regularly loses connection to the plugs and has to be reconfigured. This is what I’m facing again today, except now when trying to reconfigure the plugs in the app, I continually get “Your mobile device can’t reach the Wemo Cloud.” Reconnected my WiFi and struggled with this for ten minutes, before realizing the solution for this is to create an account. Why would I need an account? What about this service justifies an account? I’ve been disappointed in this product from the start, and this is the final annoyance.

title: App is terrible
text:
This app is quite possibly the worst app I’ve ever downloaded. I have the Wemo mini and if it wasn’t the for the Apple home compatibility I would’ve thrown this product in the garbage the week I got it. 

When the hardware is working, it works fine and I control it through the home app on my iPhone. It constantly tells me that I need an update on the wemo app but when I go to the wemo app it can’t connect to my device, can’t confirm that I do or don’t need a firmware update and when I finally got it to connect and acknowledge that there was a firmware update, the update failed halfway through and I had to reset the device to factory settings, set it up all over again. Then after all that it tells me I need a firmware update again....

Apple home app has no problem controlling the light, but the wemo app is absolute garbage. My recommendation is setup the hardware and delete the app.

title: Long time user, Crappy
text:
Long story short:  I’ve had Wemo for years now and it hasn’t gotten much better.  I don’t know if other products have similar problems, but I recommend you do your research first. 

I’ve had Wemo products for years now.  They are extremely buggy.  At least once every couple months they get disconnected and spend forever trying to connect back up to my network.  In most cases the router is 10-15 feet away, direct line of sight.  Sometimes rebooting helps, sometimes not.  Occasionally, I have to completely wipe and reinstall them.  This new “account online” thing took me several months of trying before I was finally able to create the account.  And don’t use them for anything critical like keeping an aquarium running or irrigation system etc.  As discussed they will fail.

title: Nice when it works
text:
I really like the concept of these switches. I have two minis, one light switch, and one dimmer. The biggest headache from the start has been the dimmer. 
First of all, I had to put a WiFi hub about 10ft away from it so it wouldn’t lose connection. This is likely due to the switch being installed in a metal switch box. If the box were a plastic one, I suspect it would work a bit better. But metal is the standard, so WeMo really should think of a solution. The switch also hangs after pretty much every brown out and can’t be rebooted via the reset button. The only thing that works is flipping the breaker to off for 30 seconds, then restore power again. Which is a hassle because of the location of the breaker panel. 
Lastly, after the recent update, the switch turns off an hour earlier than it is supposed to. It appears it “forgot” the rule for daylight saving time. 
The minis, on the other hand, have been fairly reliable. The switch also has given me little trouble. 
Trying to get help from customer service is futile. So I just keep helping myself.
If you expect flawless and reliable performance, buy manual switches. If you like cool toys and are willing to accept random failures, go with WeMo.

title: Smart switch F7C027
text: I Purchased the smart switch over six years ago for my outside waterfall. I first use the Wemo app on my iPhone and iPad and it worked perfectly. Then when I installed my first echo dot and I linked my Wemo smart switch to my Echo Dot I was now able to control my waterfall via voice command. It took me a little reading to figure out how to set it up and make everything work as it did. I am very happy with this device and recommend it highly and do not Understand the negative reviews unless it is a different smart plug or people are not reading the instructions and just expect things to magically can figure themselves.

title: Time to find something different
text: I bought a few plugs on a whim a couple of years ago, liked the timer function and the integration with Alexa, so I bought a few switches and dimmers. Occasional dropouts, usually caused by brownouts, so I can’t fault the product, but lately (Sept/Oct ‘21) reliability is horrible. Devices randomly becoming unresponsive, Alexa losing connection to Wemo, and the Wemo app itself not functioning. I keep checking for firmware updates… none. App updates… nope. Wipe out the whole system and start over fresh… same issues. I tried being patient, but when you pay for voice and app controlled lights, you tend to expect those to work. I find myself getting out of bed, walking through the house, and manually turning things off because Wemo isn’t working AGAIN. I’m looking for replacements. These will go in my box of failed expectation electronic devices under the stairs.

title: Easy to set up
text:
I was surprised how easy this was to set up. Picked up 3 light switches and 3 mini receptacles, a few simple steps and BAM! I am a techie person but this was simple using the Wemo App and iPhone. It’s now shared with my spouse’s iPhone and iPad. Again, so simple. Love em and will be buying more. 

The only concern is IoT’s and the devices running home so I will be putting them on my guest network in our home. Not worried that one of our friends could get on our guest network to cause problems but I do like them separate from our PC’s and other devices.

Update -  no issues after six months of use. We’ve lost power a few times during storms and I’ve never had to reinstall the Wemo devices.

title: The app is just truly awful
text:
If I had an enemy, a person I really despised and wished all sorts of evils onto, I would still not assign them the task of setting up and managing Wemo smart switches. 

Maybe the new ones that have HomeKit out of the box work well. I don’t know, because I only have 2 Insight switches, and 2 Minis. And both are just a ridiculous, painful mess to set up. 

And if your WiFi goes down for a second? Almost every other device I have manages to reconnect, as soon as it’s back, because that’s just what a half decent piece of internet-connected hardware does. 

These things, however? It’s a complete coin toss. Sometimes they come back up, and sometimes they just stay in some kind of stuck state, where they work only if you press the button manually, and can’t be used from the app — which is about as useful as not having a smart switch at all. 

That means we have to go back to the Stone Age of having to get out of bed before turning off the floor lamp, which while probably not the worst thing in the world, is sort of the exact problem that Wemo was designed to solve. 

And then you have to set them up all over again, which, see above, could be seen as a cruel and unusual punishment.

title: App is junk
text:
I've been working with 5 WeMo smart plugs and 1 switch for a couple of years. The iOS app used to have a problem where it would work fine over the cell network, but all the devices would go "Not Detected" if I tried to connect over my Wifi network. Now, after a couple of months and some updates I'm seeing the opposite. Good connection over Wifi but not detected over the cell network. In the years that I have tried to get WeMo to work, this app has always been a problem. Also, any time there is a device firmware update you have to do a complete reset to get things connected again. Because of this, don't plan on installing WeMo smart plugs behind furniture where they are hard to get to.
Now the keeps telling me that it can’t connect to any of my devices because MY IPHONE isn’t connected to the internet. Then how can I post this review?

title: WEMO Devices have serious design flaws
text:
I bought 8 WEMO Insight devices with the intention of controlling lamps in my main home as well as a separate facility a short ways away.  Two big issues:

1.  Whenever there is a power failure, or the router the devices are connected to reboots, ALL of the Insights drop from the wireless network and FAIL TO RECONNECT on their own.  Instead, I have to manually go through the process of setting up each Insight all over again, and until I do, I cannot access them to control the lights!  Not very practical if I’m away at the time of a power failure, not to mention the fact that manually reinitializing that many devices is TIME CONSUMING.

2.  The WEMO app itself only allows you to control devices attached to a SINGLE wireless network.  So in my case, where I was hoping to use the Insights at 2 different residences, I CAN’T!!

Now, you would think the folks at Belkin / WEMO would be interested in correcting these concerns - the first likely doable by a firmware update and the second by a modification to their app - but apparently not.  I’ve tried reaching out to them numerous times, and have received NO response at all.  POOR customer support to say the least.  Apparently once you’ve made the mistake of buying one of their devices, you’re stuck with how it works, like it or not.

title: No Quality Control
text:
I recently bought some more Wemo smart plugs and went to add them in the app. It told me to add them I had to “upgrade” my account to a cloud account (i.e. downgrade the security and availability by tying my devices to the internet instead of my local network). I had no other option to add my device, so I went ahead and did it.

Now only 3 of my existing 6 devices work as well as they did 2 days ago. 2 work in HomeKit and the Wemo app but don’t work with 3rd party integrations, and the other one I decommissioned to replace with one of the new ones. Of the 2 new ones I’ve added, 1 works in HomeKit and the Wemo app but not with 3rd party integrations, and the other one initially worked with HomeKit but now shows as offline and only works in the Wemo app.

Reliability is by far the most important thing for smart plugs, and Wemo’s recent updates and switching to the cloud accounts nobody asked for have completely destroyed that. With a hitrate of 2/9, there is no way they even tested these features before rolling them out.

I don’t give 1 star reviews lightly. This is not a case of “I’m angry about a new update so I’m giving 1 star.” This is a fair assessment of the quality of using this app with these devices. It is almost as bad as it could possibly be.

title: Terrible
text:
Bought these because they were self contained and when first purchased they worked beautifully... that is until Wemo forced the migration to cloud accounts and now have a bunch of worthless switches with a cloud that account that nobody wants.  This requirement infuriates me and will avoid wemo/belkin products in the future.  It is a betrayal of trust selling a product as a stand-alone then converting it to be cloud dependent.

Since the cloud migration I'm lucky if the switches work at all.  My favorite is the one that reports its status to the app when I open it however when trying to toggle its state it disappears from the app.  Awesome, but I don't really need an app just to tell me if my lights are on or off, I can already see that.  What I need is the switch part to work... it's even part of the name 'light switch'.  Seems to be a key piece of functionality that is absent here.

title: Unreliable
text:
I have two houses with multiple Wemo switches, a summer house and a winter house. Last year when I went to my winter house, within one week I lost contact with the Wemo‘s in my summer house. When I return to my summerhouse my Wemo‘s had to be reset and then they lasted roughly a couple weeks and they have to be reset again and this is seven or eight WeMo switches I had in my house.  Finally I gave up completely and removed all the WeMo’s from my summer house. Now two months later I have lost all contact with the WeMo’s in my winter house.  I can still connect to everything else at my winter house, cameras thermostat garage door and irrigation system, but I cannot connect to the Wemo’s. In the fall when I return to my winter house I will be replacing all of the Wemo’s with a more reliable product.
I do not recommend WeMo switches.  Do not waste your money on this unreliable product!!

title: Inconsistent, SLOW, support is hard to get
text:
We’ve had three Wemo outlets working(?) for a year, during that time the three outlets worked together for maybe one third of the time. There always seems to be one switch that is not showing and no matter how often I refresh it never shows. Four days ago I began updating firmware, as of this writing the firmware was still “spinning”. I decided to throw out all settings and start again. Re programmed (?) all three and surprise surprise only one outlet is working. I have tried contacting support and no dice. Very frustrating to have only one of the units working, that means it is installed correctly, yet the others don’t work. 

Really not something you want to rely on when you are not home. Better to buy the old fashioned timers that our parents used for decades. I have one of those that the only time it doesn’t come on is when the bulb is burned out.

title: Easy
text: If you’ve ever installed a light switch you’ll find this just as easy to install as far as wiring goes. Then the setup: if you can follow instructions and have a good WiFi signal (I installed this at the front door, approximately 25 feet from my WiFi router on the same level), and have your phone on the 2.4 ghz signal as instructed, you should have no problem. The app made programming and setup with Apple Home super easy. I can’t speak to earlier versions but the app settings provide for sunrise/sunrise feature to turn lights on/off. And you can vary that before, after, or precisely at sunrise/sunset. So far I’m impressed and happy with it.

title: Hope you like setting up your switches, again and again
text: The setup is a pain.  Every Switch has to be configured manually.  Seriously, they can’t save the WiFi info in the app and auto configure the switches when you connect. No you have to manually go through the lengthy steps every time.  Then after you get 10 or 15 of these things installed in your house, when you have an issue with your WiFi, get a new router, etc, you have to setup every Switch individually all over again.  Then some times just for fun it appears, the Switches lose their config and you have to set them up again.  For crying out loud please make the setup process easier.

title: Three stars for trying
text:
The app adds some cool functionality compared to what’s available in HomeKit, particularly to dimmer switches (I’d love for regular switches to also have long-press actions, but for whatever reason that’s not the case). However, the app is a bit of a mess. Particularly when it comes to single and 3-way switches, it just can’t figure them out. And maybe it’s a hardware issue, but what good is an app that can almost never detect the hardware it’s supposed to control?

There are plenty of tips and tricks online—uninstall the app, connect only to the 2.4GHz network, call a therapist—but I shouldn’t have to do any of that. These are well-known issues, so please do better QA. And if it is a hardware problem, perhaps it’s time for a full recall of the relevant products.

title: When it works, it’s fine...
text:
I’ve had a bunch of WeMo devices for a few years now. This app is incredibly buggy and there is almost no way to troubleshoot anything. Your devices will randomly be “not detected” even though you’ve never changed a thing. And sometimes, for no reason at all, they will be unreachable remotely, even though you’ve always had them set up properly with remote access turned on. 

Overall, I still really like the concept of these switches, but with no web-interface, and no way to troubleshoot...you just have to live with them not working sometimes. And if you get the WeMo Bridge to connect these to Apple’s Home Kit, that will only work maybe 60% of the time. Yet it somehow almost always with with Alexa... go figure?

YMMV, but don’t say I didn’t warn you!

title: This app needs an update after 7 months
text: My device is stuck in a software update but has been reset and disconnected. I can’t delete it because it’s says it’s updating even though it’s disconnected. I reset it and tried to reinstall but Apple says it’s not a certified Apple homekit switch. I install another brand new switch in its place but I can’t update the firmware on that one until the phantom update is finished which will never happen. This app needs an update or just close it down. You should be able to stop an update on the cloud or app to override this disaster. I may not be able to get my devices update as long as this phantom update keeps going. I’m super annoyed. Bellini needs to change this app. Also I went on the community forum for answers but it’s been decommissioned! Nice!

title: Doesn’t work well at all
text: Here’s my typical experience with the WeMo app: open the app, wait several seconds for it to come up and show everything, try to turn something off or on, things spin, shows it’s on/off but not really, hit refresh button, nothing happens, drag page down to force refresh, page refreshes and device goes offline, refresh several more times, device is now spinning yellow, refresh several more times, finally decide is showing proper state again, now try to turn device on/off, finally it works.  This is my experience PRACTICALLY EVERY TIME I USE THE APP.  Doesn’t matter which of my half dozen WeMos I’m trying to control.  This app is garbage and it has always had these problems, but seems to have gotten worse recently.  Now Rules seem to be broken as well.  Not sure why this is so complicated.  Maybe too much outsourcing to less than competent dev staff?

title: Worst initial setup ever!
text: I bought the Wemo Mini thinking it's nice to have for turning on and off the Christmas tree lights. Followed the instructions provided step by step. First time I couldn't connect to the Wemo Mini wifi. Read the troubleshoot instructions and it says to "unplug the Mini and plug it back in to reboot." Well, I tried that and the Mini wouldn't turn on! Repeated a few times and left to do something else. Came back about ten minutes later and it was able to turn on when plugging in. Finally was able to connect to the Wifi after eight times over a period of two hours then the app shuts off on its own. Opened the app but it can't find the Mini. Forced close the app and reopen it six times and still can't find the Mini. Tried to factory reset it and it wouldn't reset. Repeated this probably a dozen times and I'm so frustrated. This is the worst electronic device I've ever owned.

title: Great, when they work
text:
While this isn’t a 5 star review, I do love these wifi plugs. They’re seriously a game changer for me, and replaced my clapper. 
However, the last two weeks the app has not been functioning properly and 2 of my 3 plugs are “unavailable” on the app home screen unless I am connected to my homes WiFi. But the other 1 is connected and I can control it just fine from wherever I am. 
No updates available, nothing I can do to fix this (it seems). They were also a pita to get connected the first time, but it was worth it once they were.
Once that issue of connected vs unavailable is fixed, I’d give this a 5 star review, no doubt.
Get some!

title: Works a majority of the time, then it doesn’t
text:
I’ve been using a wemo mini plug for several years, and most of the time it’s fine. Sometimes, though, it will lose it’s connection to Alexa, HomeKit, and the Wemo app itself. The only way I’ve been able to get it working again has been to reset the plug and set it up from scratch. The app workflow to setting it up again is not sufficiently documented however, because I’ve had to use trial and error to figure out certain missing steps. The reset process needs to be better documented within the app.
More recently I got a 3-pack of the new wemo plugs, and they’re similarly reliable. Most of the time, totally fine. There always comes a day that they lose their connection and have to be reset. Exact same reset process issues.

title: The devices get disconnected from the app frequently
text:
The setup could be easier... the devices after you have set them up and worked for weeks then decide to get disconnected from the app.  Is super weird!  Alexa can turn (some of them) on and off but they are not showing on the wemo app as available.  Others not even Alexa can access!
I love the plugs, but to be honest it is becoming quite the hazzle having to reinstall them every couple of days!
The internet is the same, the phones havent changed either, i have installed every software update available for the wemo app and it still happens.  I already have 5 plugs and not looking forward to change to another brand but i am very frustrated.

title: Splendid to frustrated
text: I’ve used Wemo for years. There has always been a small to significant challenge to get them connected. Sometimes it’s a snap and other times it takes many, many attempts. But once they’re connected they worked well. The rules feature is amazing. And, again, frustrating. Tonight marks at least the third time I’ve lost all of my rules to what I can only guess is a server issue at Wemo. It’s like having to install spark plugs every time you start the car. I have too many devices to scrap them all. But I would give serious consideration to other devices if I were starting over. Having Alexa control some of them is very helpful but not a replacement for a reliable app. C’mon Wemo get it together.

title: Love the devices and the App
text: You have to wonder what other reviewers are really up to when they rate so low, claim to be savvy etc. The initial 2 devices work work as expected in a 6,000 square foot home with plenty of other connected devices including 5 thermostats, a garage door opener, smart irrigation, multiple phones and tablets, computers, streaming devices, etc. I really think it’s about knowing where do networks more than anything else. I’ve used the timer functions of the app. One turns a color laser print on and off at set times daily. The other controls a floor lamp in an upstairs room before sunset and off at a set time daily. Love these things and their app!!!

title: Improved reliability, everything else stinks
text: I’ve been using the Wemo app for years and all through that time it’s been completely unreliable. I’d often spend several minutes attempting to shut off a light when it would have been quicker to walk downstairs and do it myself. With the introduction of a mandatory account login (hooray, one more account I didn’t ask for) this hasn’t been as much of an issue. Now I have to deal with the following: Randomly needing to sign back in to an account with no option to stay logged in, password can’t be saved in iPhone password manager, devices change order w every time you log back in, and schedules don’t work half the time. I want to like this app and product, I really do, but they just can’t seem to get it right.

title: WeMo App Slow
text:
The app has nice features however each section is extremely slow to update.  For example, when opening the rules section, it took five minutes just to upload and another 7 minutes for the rules to save.  I just set this up this evening for Christmas lights, we will see if it does what it says it does.  I will update and maybe give more stars if it turns out its my WiFi connection, but that is very doubtful.

Update:  I now give it 4 stars.  The app was updated recently and it is much better.  It still has some glitches when unplugging and moving to another location, so therefore I only gave it 4 stars.  Not perfect but much improved.

title: Just installed 8 WeMo
text:
So I just wanna start off by saying that I was trying to give WeMo a 4 star review, when the app interrupted me four times in a row to ask me to review it (when I was already trying to write a review) and froze my keyboard. So 3 stars for a buggy app. And here’s why else: Wemo switches do not work with Apple HomeKit unless you buy an additional piece called a Wemo bridge. WeMo switches also do not support Dimming of lamps. Only WeMo in-wall dimmers do. My old Zwave system did this - I feel like I’ve gone back a step.

On the bright side, they are easy to set up, they all work, and they can be scheduled. And they have quick response times.

In the meantime I will be working on a solution to control my lights brightness - I may just switch to smart bulbs and sell my WeMos where I need dimming capabilities.

title: How does this have 4 stars?
text:
*Had the same Wemo plugs for 3 years, it’s same story every time I need to do anything with these*

Wemo plugs are something terrible and the app is WORSE. It looks like it was designed in 1997, and it performs like it too! Constantly crashing, won’t show devices in the interface after you have set them up, even though my Alexa picks them up after I *think* the device is on the network. I can never really tell because the native wemo app won’t show sh$t. I got home from work today at 6:30pm, I knew it would take a bit to switch over my wemo plugs to the new WiFi/router I just put in my house - only because the most simple, dummy thing, to do on anything wemo takes at LEAST 30 minutes of configuration. It’s now 10:00pm and I just finished. The app crashed about 11 times the last 3.5 hours, I have an iPhone 10x, so I’m not on a startac or something. 

Here is the good about wemo: they are cheap. That’s it, and I got what I paid for.

I also have a pair of Kasa TP-Link switches in the house, they work like a charm, the app is a thing of beauty. It took me all of 3 minutes to switch them over to the new WiFi network - combined time. If you can spare the cash, just get those.

I want to punch a kitten right now I’m so frustrated with this garbage product.

title: Not ready for prime time
text: I recently purchased and installed my third smart switch this week. I had difficulty with all three getting them set up on the app. Multiple device resets before successfully been configured. The first two I use without any scheduling and I've had no problems with functionality after initial configuration. I did set up a schedule on this most recent device. This was pretty straightforward and seems to work without any problems. The only issue I am having is that when my mobile device is not actually on the local network real time usage data does not update. Just as soon at my mobile device is back on the local network the usage data updates and registers correctly. Remote access is configured and I can control each one of my devices remotely.

title: Needs improvement
text: It doesn’t always stay connected to devices and will suddenly have to search for devices whenever I select one to turn on or off. This is tolerable. The app has bigger problems with randomly logging me out and requiring me to log back in. It doesn’t use face recognition on my phone nor does it integrate with keychain or a password manager which makes having a secure password more difficult. Integration with Apple Home is mediocre - over half my devices don’t show up there. I will say the on/off rules work well. I only have challenges when I want to access switches at other times. I hope the app and hardware will improve with time. To sum up the app in one word “irritating”.

title: New update is very frustrating
text:
First off, I couldn’t use my comcast email to make this work. I used a gmail address. Second, you need to delete the existing Wemo app first. Third, you need to remove any wemos from the Alexa skills and delete the wemo skill in Alexa. Then reinstall the app, create an account (not Comcast) and then link your Wemo devices. They should come up. Then go into Alexa and reinstall the skill, then let Alexa rediscover your wemos

The failure to link error in the Wemo app appears to either be caused by a Comcast email address when creating the Wemo account, or the Alexa skill. The skill in Alexa now needs the Wemo account to work and to get there you have to delete and reinstall the Wemo skill in Alexa to get the account prompt. 

It works now but 2 stars off for Belkin making us jump through all these hoops without instructions. 

I understand the security need to have an account associated with these devices, just the implementation process is poor and lacking in guidance. I was only able to make it work by reading other people’s reviews. I had called tech support yesterday 5/27 and they weren’t any help.

title: Good product & app, inaccessible support
text:
My Wemo Mini Smart Plugs worked more or less flawlessly- until yesterday. I launched the app on my tablet to turn one of the switches on, and it wanted to do a firmware update. While it was updating, it turned the device off. I waited for the update to complete, then switched it back on. After about 5 seconds, it turned itself back off. It repeated this behavior at least a dozen times. Every time I switched it on, regardless of whether I used the app or the switch on the Smart Plug, it shut itself off immediately or within 5 seconds. 

I decided to try from my phone. The app again wanted to install a firmware update. I again installed it, to no effect. 

I called Tech Support. After 36 minutes on hold, I opted for the call-back. After another 20 minutes, I got a call back, and was immediately on hold again. I gave that 7.5 minutes before giving up, having never spoken to an actual human. 

In the meantime, I’d gone into the WEMO app and manually initiated a third firmware update. After that, the malfunctioning Smart Plug began to function normally again, no thanks to WEMO Tech Support. 

Upshot:  Fine product and app, as long as you don’t need to communicate with them.

title: Can’t update firmware without removing and reinstalling app
text:
I have 7 Wemo Mini switches in my house. After the initial setup of the first couple switches (at the same time) several months ago, as I’ve acquired new switches, I’ve been unable to update the firmware on any of them without having to remove the Wemo app from my phone and reinstall it. After installation, it sees the outdated firmware and updates it immediately, but if I get another switch at a later date, that installation will never launch the firmware update. I can look at the hardware info and see that the firmware is out of date but do not get a menu item to update it.

This is happening on both my iPhone 6+ and my new iPhone X.

Glad I saw the uninstall/reinstall trick to work around this, but there’s definitely a bug in the app that has been there for months!

title: Do not buy
text: Worst app I’ve used  so far. Takes hours to download new firmware. After downloading The switch works for about 2 days than I have to completely resist the switch by discounting the black wire. The button on the bottom of the switch is not enough to reset. I have 20 other switches in the house that are of the Kasa brand and are less expensive and I’ve had zero problems. As I writes this I’m downloading yet another firearm update that is still downloading after 4 hours.  If this update doesn’t correct the problem I will be switching the last few switches over kasa switches. By the way I have  absolutely no affiliation to kasa  they just work as advertised. The Wemo switch is much more attractive but just isn’t working as advertised . I’m not seeking retribution just FYI for those trying to decide what switch to go with.

title: Working again...
text:
App was working fine for months, then it couldn’t connect to WiFi or use cellular network. In settings it was allowed to use cellular, and the WiFi was up and running. Never had issues before. What happened?

I was able to use Apple HomeKit to turn on an outlet controller, but Wemo app was a no go. I had just installed a new Wemo 3-way switch. Was working as a switch but no blinky-blinky lights to let me know it was connecting. Pressed the reset WiFi button and suddenly voila! The app connects lights go blinky and everything works. No idea what the heck just happened but it’s all working in Wemo app and with Siri, so I’m happy. Connecting another switch tomorrow, hope it goes smoothly.

Three stars for iffy configuration.

title: The new required login is a regression.
text:
One of my favorite things about the wemo devices is that I could control them without a login. The new required login is not only an annoyance but it also doesn’t work with standard password manager features requiring you to switch out of the app and use the less secure copy and paste method when using a password manager. If you’re going to require me submitting to your analytics and data mining at least make it convenient.

Update: They have added support for password managers! Thank you! I still wish I could access my local devices without dialing out to centralized servers but I appreciate the responsiveness of the developers with allowing password management.

title: Could not be worse. Complete fail.
text:
Nothing software EVER works from this company. I would never recommend a Belkin Wemo product, especially their light and dimmer switches to anyone I know. Awful terrible horrible setup experience. Often requires you delete the app, restart your phone, reconnect with the device tenuously via wifi. Then an error occurs so now repeat that 10 min sequence again and again until it finicky decides you have had enough torture. 
New update app with device accounts doesn't work. Error message immediately on first step when entering email. Go figure not surprising. 
Customer support is a shack out in the Philippines. Good luck with that. 
For the cost of device, and Belkins name behind it it's hard to grasp the incompetence of this software and it's engineering team. 0 stars. Scrap it all and try again.

title: Stay away. Bait and switch
text:
Initially it was good, you were not forced to create account with Wemo. After few firmware updates, Wemo is forcing you to create an account otherwise they will keep your devices hostage. Doesn’t matter if you are tired or hungry or sleepy, Wemo wants you to create an account or login to your account before you can flip a switch in your own house!!
Not to mention, app kicks you out even if you were logged in last you checked. Firmware update of your devices force you to set it up again from scratch!!!
If someone from Wemo reads it, I am controlling a lamp for heaven’s sake. At mid night don’t force me to create or login to an account before I can go to bed. The world doesn’t revolve around your stupid corporate policies. Your devices play a tiny role in our lives. Don’t force it to be bigger than it ought to be.

title: When it works it’s great. But!
text:
Among the various connected hardware, I have spent hours trying to keep Wemo plugs working. When these plugs are working I may go weeks using and enjoying the convenience. Then I wake up one day and one or more won’t turn on. So I spend an hour going thru various steps until I find a fix. This includes hard resets & reinstalling. 

And then there’s Alexa! Most things just work. But not Wemo! It’s more like they just don’t! The connection to Alexa triples the number of lost connections and sometimes requires removing any mention of the plugs. Then you have to delete the apps as well and start over! Right now, a new version of Alexa is keeping the Wemo plugs from working at all! And so it goes!

title: Very Poor App - no confidence it will work.
text:
Even writing this review was difficult. Couldn’t get a keyboard to type comments. Had to try multiple times. App took me to an option to open the App. This circle had no end. Finally found a way to break the cycle. 
Creating rules is very difficult. I created a simple rule to turn on Wemo Mini at sundown and turn off at 11:30 pm. I then added this rule to two mini’s. They turn on about an hour apart but turn off at the correct time. I can’t find a remedy. So frustrating. You can set up a good rule but have zero confidence on when devices will actually actuate. It appears to be random. I have to set an alarm in my calendar to tell me to go to the app and manually activate the device at the correct time if it hasn’t done so on it’s own. I can not recommend this device or app.

title: WEMO is the best as long as you have reliable WIFI
text: I bought Wemo when they first came out. There were a lot of bugs like any new product. I stayed with them and now I have 17 devices I use almost daily without a hitch. During the Christmas season I add 8 more devises. All I say is “Hey Google, turn on the Christmas lights” and every Christmas light Comes on. A few years back, I did have intermittent issues until I bought the ORBI mesh Wifi system. That provided a strong WiFi signal throughout the house. Wemo has worked perfectly from then on with no glitches!  I am a very satisfied customer! 5 Stars!

title: Bright Idea
text: We think this is fantastic.  We use it to turn on lights in a room before we get to the room, or turn off lights if we forgot to turn them off. We use it as as a wake up for my grandson, we set the time for 5:45am to turn on his bedroom lights to help wake him up for school, when we're gone we can turn lights on and off in different rooms from our iPhone to make the house look occupied, from anywhere,  and turn lights on before we get home so we don't have to enter a dark house. We just love it. We have recommended the devices to 3 people, and they have also purchased the devices. Great product.

title: This app is awful
text: This might be my 2nd bad review of this app, but I’m so frustrated. I’m contemplating looking for a completely new “smart” infrastructure.  I have 4 Wemo switches and 2 of them are dimmer switches so I’m pretty highly invested.  My 1st issue was getting all the switches to sync at initial setup (make sure you have the latest version of the app). I would  try for hours to get the switches to sync up, only to realize it wouldn’t work until I updated my app.  My newest complaint is it won’t even let me login. I was in it last night, now I was going to look at stuff today and I’m logged out. I tried to login. Evidently I don’t have the right password, won’t let me login.  Tried recover password, get an error, tried to creat a new account, get an error.  Tried to go on the website, says download the free app.  What a joke!

title: Good overall but...
text:
I’m not a big review writer but I felt strongly enough about this product to do so. When the app is working, it is the best thing in the world. However, there are too many times where the devices just simply cannot be detected, and no easy options available for them to be detected again, and even when I turn the device on and off manually. 
There are many improvements that can be made with this app. First off, Wemo should make a widget so it will be easier to access through the notification center, or when we swipe to the far left on our home screen. Secondly, the app really needs a redesigning because it looks like the app came from the early 2010’s. 
That’s just my 2 cents but what do I know?

title: Wemo wall plugs
text:
Wemo wall plugs are the worst ones I have including wall switch

I have 4 wall wall plugs and only one will hook up after trying without exaggerating for over 2 weeks and and the one wall switch my porch light I lost the icon in the app can’t find it anywhere it still turns on and off with the timer 
I finally went to a cheaper brand and it was up and running in no time had it in for over a month and it doesn’t skip a beat
Called for help and support told me I need a new router now why would I need a new router when everything else works I just think that all they are interested in is making as much money as they can and not  worry about the quality  of their products listen to me buy the cheap one you can buy a box of 4 for the price of one Wemo and works with no lost signals

title: Horrible app
text: I bought these switches and outlets and they used to work fine until WEMO updated their app and lost my account. I finally got them all set back up and WEMO did an app update shortly after. Now none of the timers (rules) work. After about an hour and a half on the phone with tech support they said there is a problem with several customers switches and they are working on it. There was an update three days ago to the app and firmware update to the switches that specifically said it fixed the bugs that were effecting the timers. I tried to set up timers on these switches again and nothing works. I will not waste anymore time and money with this company. I will be switching all of these switches and outlets to another company as soon as possible. Don’t waste your money and time with this company.

title: App a tight
text:
Finally got the App setup correctly with the requirement or an account. I had to delete all stored app info on my kindle, before it would allow me to put user and password in. I ignored the part where it asked me to setup my devices. Closed and reopened the app and all my devices were there. 
I have used multiple plugins for a few years now. I used them mostly for Christmas lights but now I use them year round. Nice to setup on off times remotely, but mostly just to ask Alexa to turn on and off. Hopefully this time the app will just plain work without any hiccups.

title: App is Decent. WeMo Mini is Pretty Good.
text:
I currently have one WeMo Mini. Device turns on or off when the physical device button is pressed. Device also turns on and off via the app over WiFi and remotely.

In order to get scheduling to work, I had to restart my router (Netgear Nighthawk). Since doing this, scheduling seems to work thus far. 

4/5 features seem to be working. Physical button works, WiFi App On/Off works, Remote On/Off works, HomeKit does not work because I am unable to update device. No update option appears and when I attempt to set up Home App, it says I need to update. I press update. It returns to “More” menu and does nothing.

This issue isn’t a make or break but I’d love it to work. 

Overall I like the design of the device itself. None of these plugs are thin and light but at least this one doesn’t look like cheap junk. The device does make a clicking sound when turning it on and off. Not an issue to me but I’m throwing that out there for knowledge. 

Overall I do love my purchase. I’ll switch to 5 stars when they fix my inability to update.

title: Just want to control a plug, not give out my email
text: They keep changing the use case for this device. I can no longer use the app to control a single plug without giving yet another company my email to misuse. It now requires an account and internet access (for the account) which would have stopped me from purchasing it in the first place had I known they were going to go in this direction. I just want an internal network method to turn on/off a plug to a device that has no on/off switch. I do not need any other features, I do not need to turn it on/off from work or across the world, I do not need scheduling, and I do not want an account. If someone is already on your internal WiFi network you’ve got bigger problems than someone accessing your plugs. Let me use it with as minimally as I want.

title: Up and died
text: Whatever you all did with the latest firmware update has made all my devices unusable, and I am livid. I have 3 smart plugs that I’ve used consistently for almost 3 years without issue. Yesterday I plugged my Xmas lights into one, and it wasn’t able to connect to the WiFi (no trouble when I unplugged it from another outlet literally 30 seconds ago). The app told me there was a firmware update, so I clicked install....and it kept installing for 10+ hours until I googled similar issues and was recommended to uninstall and reinstall the app. Since then I have gone in circles with all 3 plugs, with the app walking me through connecting with the device, connecting to WiFi, reconnecting to the device in a vicious cycle that has yet to complete. Done with Wemo now. Tossing these out and will be switching to the Alexa plugs.

title: Does what I expected and more
text: For about 4 years I’ve been using the switchable wall plugs. The fact that I could turn on and off the items from a remote location was an added benefit. Such as turning on or off the engine heater to my car in the winter or setting the wemo automatically to turn on, and off a few hours before work. This would give heat much sooner as the engine was pre-warmed. The newer wemo’s track your power usage and give an accurate readout of the amount of electricity used per day and a monthly estimation. Well done if you ask me. They have been reliable and worked very well. Once a firmware update failed on one but resetting it solved the issue.

title: It works for Mr Coffee.
text:
When you run the install process for Mr. Coffee you will notice that Mr Coffee seems to be an after thought. All the Dimmers, switches, etc... connect without a hitch. Me Coffee connects in spite of the app. 
The functionality is great. I can start Coffee from anywhere in the world. The app shows me if the coffee maker is ready or low on water (i.e. I didn't add water because I forgot to prep the machine.)
The integration with Alexa is flawlessly. I can lazily start Coffee.
However everywhere you look for help, there is no mention of Mr Coffee. Don't get frustrated when you run the app, look for Mr Coffee and it doesn't appear. It is there. Just continue on. Shut the app down, with no devices listed. When you restart the app, viola! Again, it works in spite of the app.
Would I buy again?
Yes. It works well. The app and install process just need some attention.
Oh yeah... the filter in Mr Coffee.
I can't use it. The filtration of water seems to hamper the watering of the coffee grounds. If you get weak coffee and noticed 2/3 of your grounds were never touched by hot water, try removing the filter. Worked for me.

title: Needed This
text:
I have a cabin that has a driveway that’s extremely dark. I have been using a similar phone controlled light switch controlling floods that was okay with occasional/ some connectivity issues and was recalled and pulled off market ( Woods Wion).
 I am in the second season with the Wemo wall switch and have had very good luck with only a few connection problems. My wife also uses the app to control the switch with her phone. On the occasion when we need costumer services, they are fabulous. I gave it 4 stars because I could not overcome issues without having to call tech support.
It is an excellent product and solid application.

title: Updated review
text:
I earlier removed my one star rating as after a long wait on the phone with a WeMo tech, I have my devices back up and running.
Believe this or not! I had to remove my account using my Comcast email and use another email service. 
I had to power down a couple of my devices to have them be discovered by the app. After about an hour’s work, WeMo devices and app working as before update (BTW I have had hardly any problems in my 5 years with WeMo products)
Also, be AWARE YOU MUST remove all WeMo devices from Alexa app FIRST, unlink your WeMo skill then relying with your new WeMo account. Hope this might help someone!

title: Eases what already seems should be simplest in home management
text:
Turning on and off a light switch doesn’t seem like a big deal. But to schedule use of lights in a small home, by the sun, pre-arranged schedule, and / or one device carried anywhere turns out none the less to be very helpful in efficiently managing energy usage, security, and safety. Wemo smart plugs work in a multi-level home with simple Wifi network. No electrical or techie knowledge or skills required. Looking forward to installing Wemo smart light switches and dimmers to expand my system.
Belkin can do a little more work to make smart plug rule setup menu choices a little more intuitive, which would give it a fifth star.

title: Lots of Crashes, Only Works Half the Time
text: Earlier versions were better and didn’t crash as frequently, but the issue of only working half the time has been around a while. I use my Wemo Switch to Control a relay that opens and closes my garage door, but I don’t want to damage the motor or the relay, so I always need to turn it on and then immediately off. Depending on the connection, I’ll be able to turn it on, and then off is another story. The app will say the device is off, but after refreshing several times, alternating using the refresh button and pulling down, the switch status reverts to on. Developers could fix this by allowing the auto-off feature to use increments of 1, 5, or 10 seconds.

title: Love it
text: This is the only Wemo device I have and use. For about 4 years. I have used this device to power a relay switch out in my out-building. It automatically turns my air compressor on in the morning and then back off in the evening. Allowing me to use air plumbed into my garage without ever hearing the loud compressor. Although at first it had a few glitches. After a couple software updates and my improved home WiFi. This thing is incredibly reliable. Even if the power goes out and comes back. My settings stay and it performs flawlessly. Thanks Wemo.

title: Good and Bad
text: I’ve had Wemo since the beginning and can tell you they’ve worked out a lot of the bugs. I have been ready to rip it out at times but held with it. Very happy now. Have several switches and several plugs. The rules work well and remote access works too. It is sometimes very “wonky” but now I’ve got it all working and I can set it and forget it. I still don’t understand how it determines what time it is but I can deal with that. Some devices are set one hour either forward or backwards. There is robust WiFi for all units so it doesn’t quite make sense.

title: When it works I love it, when it doesn’t I hate it!
text: My light switch always has trouble connecting to Alexa every time the internet or power goes out. Once the internet is back no matter if I wait days or weeks it won’t connect until I do several full resets and even then is a nightmare. Now that the new update came out and I created an account now it won’t even connect to the Wemo app. I was struggling to reconnect and after rebooting my internet several time finally got it. Today my power when out, again, and now it won’t connect to app even after rebooting. The thing is it will work with my Apple Home App and no orange light is blinking but in the Wemo app it shows the swith is not responsive and won’t connect to Alexa. SUPER FRUSTRATING!!

title: Gone Bad
text: Used my WeMo wall switch and lamp controller for years without trouble. Now it insists I login to some extraneous server for no good reason. Worse, the App will arbitrarily lose track of my stored account name and Face Recognized password. It is like I just installed the App for the first time. Of course, I don’t realize this until I try to go to bed and shut the lights off with my iPhone. I don’t recall my user and password. Never had to in the past just to shut the lights off. I have get out of bed and shut the lights off the old fashioned way. Don’t buy this junk. Wish I could skip this business of logging in that was never required when I first bought these devices. They ruined a good product. Don’t buy. You want something that just works. It is supposed to be a light switch!

title: Fails to Recognize/Easily Drops WiFi
text: We have many smart devices that quickly connect and work seamlessly with our WiFi. This is the only smart device that makes us want to throw it out of the nearest window. It takes an immense amount of time, patience, and an obvious degree of luck to get our mini smart plug to recognize WiFi. Once the device finally recognizes WiFi, it then consistently fails to recognize the smart plug device, itself, to complete set up. If the stars align and set up is miraculously completed, it takes even more time and patience to (re)connect the device - again - when it loses WiFi connection. On a positive note, once (if) set up is successfully completed and the device manages to maintain a WiFi connection, the functionality of the device is fairly consistent and easy to use when paired with Alexa.

title: A Convenient Gadget
text: Took hours to get set up and working, but once you get it set up it’s quite convenient to use and seems to work well.  I must say that WEMO/Belkin Support (by phone) is probably the best I’ve experienced.  Very helpful staff who will spend whatever time it takes to get you up and running.  They are knowledgeable, polite, and patient.  And you can talk to them on the phone without sitting on hold for hours.  I would buy more if these knowing that even though they can be a little difficult to set up, there is such strong support available to back the product.  So convenient to turn the lights on before getting home on my phone.  Love it.

title: It can be good
text: I’ve had Wemo light switches and plugs for a while and it can be good. I recently bought a new light switch to replace the old one I had so that it would be compatible with HomeKit and so far nothing but problems. The light switch had a firmware update and has been stuck for over a week now. I use both Alexa and HomeKit devices in my house and I need the Wemo app to work to have access to both. The firmware was updating but I was able to access the switch via HomeKit but the switch disappeared from Alexa. I tried uninstalling the app and restore the switch and now it’s back to firmware update and disappeared from HomeKit and Alexa. This is getting frustrating trying to make your house smarter with not so smart devices.

title: Buggy app, constant crashes, doesn’t work with mesh network
text:
I recently upgraded to a mesh network using the Netgear Orbi RBK850 WiFi 6 model and i can no longer connect my smart switches or dimmer. I have the 2nd gen of both models.
During the set up process, the WeMo asks to connect to a network and it will show 3 SSID’s with the same name rather than one. This could be causing the issue, or the WiFi chip in the Wemos is cheap and cannot differentiate between 2.4 and 5ghz to connect to the network, OR the firmware needs an update. The app crashes during the setup process, or it times out. I don’t know what it is, but I’ve been on with level 2 support from belkin and no one could fix the problem. 

A response from the engineering team would be great if they’re working on an update to resolve this. Thank you!

title: Worked okay for a while
text:
I bought the Wemo Mini Switches late last year, probably October or so. Worked just fine, I could connect them to my HomePod and control the lights with a few rules. Then comes yesterday when the Wemo just turns off randomly. Never happened before this, so I’m dumbfounded why it’s starting now. The app has away mode where it’ll automatically turn the light on/off to simulate someone being home, but I’m at home and when it turned off, I told Siri to turn the light back on, it turns on, and a couple minutes later it turns itself off again. I’m obviously home! Luckily I think I disabled the rule and it’s been okay for a few minutes now. Giving it 3 stars for now unless it acts up again.

Update 1: it’s acted up again. I’m getting rid of these and getting actual smart bulbs. Garbage app/switch

title: From awesome to useless
text: I loved my Wemo app. After they forced account creation but didn’t put up a screen to let users know that, instead just cutting off access to the Wemos, after I created an account and then lost access because I didn’t click a link in an email that never came, trying to reset the password so I could force it to send another verification email, being unable to do so, uninstalling and reinstalling the app, FINALLY being able to reset my password, FINALLY being able to verify my email, and FINALLY being able to log back into the account I was forced to create... after all of that... now it won’t find any of my devices. It just spins. Kill the app- spins. Reboot my phone- spins. Reboot every Wemo in the house- Spins.  The app and all of my Wemo devices are useless.

title: Horrible!!!
text: This SHOULD be simple. Customer support is NOT helpful. I need a “level 3” tech to remove a device off my list from an older household. You, the customer are not allowed the ability to edit your device list. Also, my old roommates have UNAUTHORIZED access to all my Wemo devices in a home, in a state that they’ve never even stepped foot onto, much less connected to the WiFi here. Also, all their new devices they just connected a month ago are showing up on my list as well!!! After this... I will never again purchase, support nor recommend any Belkin device. Now I have to wait by the phone for 24 hours whenever that department can call me. Horrible customer service! I had to have a supervisor help me. I asked the first agent to repeat what I just said and TWICE he made up his own story. Twice. This is just horrible.

title: Don’t upgrade your internet service
text:
I’ve owned 2 Wemo mini smart plugs for 6 months. Over that time period, Wemo failed to detect each of the devices more times than I can count. Sometimes they work, sometimes not. Then we made the mistake of upgrading our internet by going with a new provider with much higher speeds. Can’t get the Wemo app to detect either smart plug, even after resetting both 5 times!  Even removed the app from my phone and started over from scratch. Have done that 3 times now, with no success. 
The Belkin website is a joke - can’t find any troubleshooting info at all, and the search function is useless. Type in “reset”, and you get only topics for Belkin router, or Belkin range extender. No other topics. Similar if you type in “install”. Can’t even get basic instructions from this crap website. What a joke!

title: Worst ‘smart’ device ever
text: Worked in IT For years, extremely comfortable with computers and WiFi connected devices of all sorts. Went through the full gamut of troubleshooting tricks, tips for resets, moving routers, disconnecting other WiFi connected devices etc etc. still to no avail. If you recall the first time turning on a brand new phone that comes fully charged and being able to jump right in and you realize how amazing an experience that is, this was the exact opposite ... All in an attempt to turn off a light using the Wemo mini! Womp womp. Silly me for picking the thing up on a wim. The amount of frustration and time wasted will quite possibly require months of using a properly working Wemo / Wemo app to play catch up for the massive inconvenience of this first go around. Majorly disappointed!

title: Worked for me
text:
I have seen several reviews slamming either WeMo products or the WeMo app. Well, All I can say is that I bought a two pack of the mini plug, downloaded the app, installed everything, and it all worked first time. I even hooked it up to work with Alexa, and that went smoothly as well.

I gave four stars rather than five mainly because the scheduling functionality of the app is not very intuitive and a little difficult to figure out at first. However, it’s fine once you know how.

Go ahead and buy the mini plugs. I doubt you’ll have the kind of difficulty others have reported, but if you do, it’s not going to break the bank.

title: Works well most of the time
text:
Mostly my 4 WEMO Mini work as expected.  But about every couple months one or more WEMO drops Internet connection.  When this happens I must do a restart.  This can be one of several levels, from just the WEMO device to a complete shut down & restart of the complete internet and supported devices.

In short the reliability of the system is poor.
In the latest software up date I am told a password with multi characters will be required, no null password allowed.  I have no need and do not want a password to control my l lamps.  I will stick with the olde software version.

title: I love these little things!
text: I moved 3x since I bought my WeMo wall outlets and they’re awesome everywhere I use them.  Be it a lamp, a fan, a heater or the doggie cam I love being able to hit a button from anywhere and my WeMo flips the switch.  Just amazing!!  The other day, my new roommate who is very energy conscious and I could learn a lot from her, turned off my lamps and fan after I’d left for work.  I came home and asked her to ask me to shut them off the next time so I’ll be better about remembering (plus she doesn’t have to witness my messy room).  She’s 64 yo and when I explained how she was just amazed...as am I.  Thanks!

title: Does Not Play Well With Others
text:
My first smart plug was WeMo. I loved that I was able to turn on and off the bedroom light from my phone. That was almost 4 years ago... I’ve since grown up and purchased a SmartThings hub. My home is now full of all kinds of smart plugs, outlets, and sensors. 

Unfortunately, WeMo has not really grown up. I enjoy my WeMo dimmer switch but wish it worked with SmartThings. The SmartThings hub allows for more advanced rules. For example, {if} someone rings my doorbell after sunset {while} I’m not home {then} turn on the living room light {and} send me a text message.

All in all, I’m about to donate all of my WeMo devices to my parents. They struggle with technology, so the WeMo should be simple enough for them to use.

title: Works perfect!!!
text: Works perfectly!!! Never had a problem!!! Wanna get more to help control more stuff around the house!!! Sad they did away with the wemo heater!! 🤬🤬🤬 Ima try & buy one if I can find one, one day... Hopefully they bring them back because they were nice!!! Not many on the market... Guess I’ll buy a Dyson heater/fan... Smfh... Also why you put about the update for HomeKit & day it will take till the 26 to be released fully... You need to fix all products go work with HomeKit... Everything works with Alexa... Rarely things work with HomeKit... 😭😭😭 I use Alexa more anyway... Wish we could use Alexa with iPhone don’t get me wrong I love Apple but Siri needs rebuilt... 😭😭😭

title: Avoid this junk company app & products
text: Today 1.5 hours and around 2 years ago, more than an hour. Thats the amount of time I have wasted in my life to setup this company’s junk products. I really wish they die or go bankrupt. I am tech savvy person and have tons of tplink and this junk company’s first gen smart plug(or whatever you call for its form factor) I fell prey to amazon’s con marketing of this junk companys mini plug and bought it. Seriously worst app to setup and I will never ever buy anything from them. Even if I have to live like caveman, thats better than attempting 50 times to setup a mini plug that got reset itself because I turned off power strip on which it was connected(and hence working) for last two years! Gosh!!! Wemo, just die and I will be very very happy to hear that and saved thousands of hours for humanity.

title: Big brother is tracking you
text: I used to use wemo switches until their operation changed. Wemo used to be simple plug-and-play. NOT ANY MORE! wemo has joined the big brother bandwagon. I don’t have internet, so I can no longer use wemo devices. In order to use wemo now, you have to create an account, register your devices, provide wemo with your personal information AND be logged into their system in order to use anything. So, not only do you have to let wemo know what devices you have, you have to let them know when you’re actually using them.  Eventually, I suspect wemo will decide WHEN and IF they will allow you to use their devices depending on local energy availability and your political views. Another device on its way to the landfill. Welcome back to 1984!

title: These devices are garbage DO NOT BUY!!!
text: Ever since installing they have never maintained a connection with my wifi. I have only two devices and they’re installed in the room with my router. After reading forums and finding people with the same problem you find the wemo tech support reach out to offer advice but it always says the same thing. I have a very stable internet connection and I’ve restarted and reset the devices from my home network, checked connections to ensure my devices are connected to the proper 2.4 Ghz, and reset my app so many times I’m blue in the face. If you’re having this problem trash these devices and go another route. If you’re looking into them, don’t even. Save yourself the time, effort, money, and headache. Charlatans these people are! Charlatans!

title: New Update Is awful! Revised to GOOD
text: I wrote the review below a few days ago and since then the problems have cleared up. There has not been another update and I have not changed anything with our WiFi. Possibly it was Belkin remote servers? The problem is now corrected so I am changing my review of this software version. Previous review: I updated to Version 1.18.2 the app fails repeatedly. I have 7 WeMo devices they work occasionally but they keep coming up as “not detected “. I keep having to kill the app and restart on my 7+ , but that only works occasionally. The previous version worked flawlessly! Please bring it back!!

title: Incredibly difficult to program.
text:
My first Wi-Fi receptacle was a Sharper Image. Easy to schedule multiple daily on/off times. Easy to start up and set number of minutes ‘til time off. Easy to link to iPhone app and get using within minutes. 

wemo pretends programmer sophistication with “rules” lingo; such contrived affectation would not be so onerous if it actually served the customer well. Enable-disable?! Wasn’t able to suspend set timer and manually turn off and set time off minutes. BTW the Costco associate who help me find these believes they only function with Alexa. Confusion abounds. Operation is befuddling.

title: Don’t buy
text: I have had the Wemo products installed and working in my home for several years. There was occasionally a drop of a device that required reset or reinstall. However I recently upgraded my cable modem to an arris surfboard and wireless mesh to eero pro 6. Come to find out that the wemo devices which are all in 2.4 ghz won’t work on a dual band network. Wemo help simply said to start over. Even after physically removing 10 wall switches and theee plugs and starting literally from Scratch I can’t get these working. Wemo tech support is worthless. It might as well not even exist. $600 bucks worth of wemo products are now worthless and I’m looking for an alternative. I had chosen Wemo because they’re part of the larger Belkin system which normally makes quality products.

title: Very unstable app. Too many bugs
text: Setting up my WeMo mini switches was a hassle and required several hard resets on the units. I had one set up and updated, which took several attempts. Now I’m adding 2 more and when I’m lucky to get them set up, their firmwares won’t update. The app does not show the button to request the update. When I open the section to integrate with HomeKit inside the WeMo app, it shows that my 2 new units need to be updated and when I click on the button to update, it kicks me back to the previous screen in the “More” menu. I committed the mistake of unpairing the new units to try repairing them, and it took another several (more than 10) attempts to get them paired again. The app needs some serious upgrading and a more seamless pairing process is way overdue. Please fix those issues!

title: Why are you forcing me to have an account?
text: I’ve had these two Wemo switches for about 5 years. One of them started to not follow the rules set for it. Try everything, eventually a factory reset. To add this Wemo switch back I’m now told I have to create an account (why so you can send marketing bs to me!) no way to continue without creating an account. So I create an account...try to add back the Wemo switch. I get an account error message. I retry and retry,  It then looks like it was successful but it turns out it had reset the other Wemo switch (even though I never touched its reset button) and now the app had locked me out of two devices. Thus giving me yet another password to remember another security liability on my email address and two useless devices. Trash.

title: Still no grouping capability since 2013
text:
Been collecting WeMo’s as holiday gifts, birthday gifts, and buying them directly over the years since 2013. Lots of features and improvements added since then but...I still cannot group my switches/outlets, even after 6 years, the Wemo development team still has not done this while new competition has created itself entirely in this same smarthome automation space with the ability to group switches/outlets. Why?

Once Wyze starts selling their favor of switches/outlets and if history repeats itself they will significantly undercut WeMo’s prices...that’s where I am going. They actually listen to their users and actively moderate their own forums...oh wait...does Wemo even have its own community forum to listen to customer feedback...no!

title: Three days and firmware update still going
text:
A few years ago I bought the Wemo smartplug and I set it up with the Wemo app and it worked as designed. I didn’t like it so I returned it.

Recently I got the same as a gift so I opened my Wemo app and decided to add the new smartplug to it. My home WiFi has WPA3 and the Wemo plug wouldn’t connect to it. So I downgraded my WiFi to WPA2 and went thru the configuration steps and it wouldn’t add the plug to my account. Then I went thru the unlinked plug setup many times and this plug still couldn’t be added to my account. Finally it showed up but for the last three days it’s trying to upgrade its firmware when I’m on a fiber 1GB internet connection.

Wemo has gone down in quality over the last couple of days. Stay away for your mental sanity.

title: Stellar devices!
text:
I purchased 2 Wemo light switches some 3 years ago. They turn on/off my front porch and coach lights at sunrise/sunset. They have worked flawlessly for the past 3 years. 

I purchased a Wemo dimmer switch for my rear backyard patio 6 months ago. Set up sunrise/sunset for this switch, as well. It has worked with no issues. 

Today, I received 2 Wemo mini plugs. Each was set-up is a few short minutes. These 2 will units will also turn lights on/off at sunrise/sunset. I expect these 2 smart plugs to work flawlessly like their counterparts.

title: Wemo accounts are half baked
text:
If Belkin wants to add authentication to Wemo for “security,” fine, but that requires a lot more QA than they actually did, at least on the iOS app.

Introducing accounts has disconnected an integration upon which I relied for years, and though I had no objection whatsoever to signing up for an account and did so immediately when prompted, now with my shiny new Wemo account I can’t sign into the partner’s site to reconnect the integration - making my house full of Wemo devices worthless. 

Also, forcing account signup to happen in the app (where selecting a complex, secure, not easily guessed password is extremely difficult) instead of on the desktop website is dumb, as is telling me what characters are “required” or “not permitted” in my password.

title: Love it!
text: I bought the mini outlet and set it up within 5 minutes of being home. The app walked me through the set up and I’m really happy with how easy it is to use. I haven’t had any connectivity issues or problems with the app. I wanted my lamp turned on in my living room when I get home at night and when I leave for work in the morning. The app allows me to have the light turn on and off automatically or adjust as I please- so I can come and go feeling more safe. I would recommend this product, I will be buying more in the future!

title: Convenience and safety
text:
I bought two outlets.  One I am using to turn on a light for when I return home late, after timers have turned lights off.  I have 3 steps to climb in the dark otherwise before getting to a light switch.  

The other I am using to turn Christmas tree lights on and off.  I used to use a timer but then the tree would be on when I wasn’t nearby to enjoy it.  Saves energy, and more convenient than reaching down behind the tree to switch the timer. 

I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because installation of both got confused because I did the update between setting them up.  I had to delete the app and start over and only did the update after I had both outlets installed.  There were moments I thought I would need to return them.  I’m glad I didn’t. 

 I already have ideas for where to use the second one after Christmas.  Maybe a light switch for when I get up in the night, or a light switch where I usually forget to turn off a light.

title: Pretty good, if you ignore the app
text:
I've got my WeMo devices in HomeKit, where they work really well.  The app is another story. The app shows the devices need an update, which i do, I even get the pop up message saying it's done. but then a couple of seconds later it says it needs to update. Again. Ugh. 
Also- the bridge does not show up in the app. It's required for one of my older devices (see how good they are? Years later it's still working), but the bridge is slow to respond and never appears in the app. But if I remove the bridge, the older devices stop working. 🤷🏼‍♀️

title: Belkin needs to fix these!
text: I have one of the older style plugs and it continues to work fine. I bought a 3 pack of the Mini plugs and have found them basically worthless. I set two of them up on the network. One failed to complete a firmware update and I have given up on it. The second one failed the latest firmware update. It shows up on the account and says it is online but when you try to turn it on from the app the power button goes away. If you hit the refresh it shows back up but still shows the upgrade failed. Every time you try the update you get the update complete Hooray notice but it still shows the update failed. So now I have 2 of the 3 that don’t work. My advice is don’t buy these!

title: Extremely disappointed
text: Since the last app update, 2 more of our Wemos stopped working, AGAIN! It took at least an hour of frustration to get these to work again in the past. Now, after 2 hours of trying to reset and re-add it to the Wemo app, it still does not work!  The app only wants to add the devices to the Apple Home app (even if the Apple Home app is not on your phone) and never appears in the Wemo app or Alexa after the app says it was added successfully. We do NOT want to use the Apple Home app because only one household member has an Apple phone. This is absolutely ridiculous how often the Wemos disconnect from the app and should not waste hours of our time to attempt resetting them every time!!!  I will NEVER buy a Wemo again!

title: Latest App is Horrible
text: The app removed one of my devices and after creating my account, I tried to add the device and it keeps telling me I need to create an account. If I click log in and enter my credentials, it says the combo isn’t valid. I have reset the password and get the same thing. I tried to create an account again and it says I have one already but when I open the app again it prompts me to create an account. It is an endless loop. I tried to do a support chat and after 10 minutes was told my problem should be handled by phone. I called and none of the options provided in their IVR work for my issue. I think I will have to buy new devices by a different company so my smart switches will work again. So disappointed.

title: Not happy
text: I’ve had the app along with 2 smart plugs and a belkin camera for years with no problems. I attempted to add a mini plug before a trip but couldn’t get it to connect. While traveling, I tried to connect to my camera to turn on email notifications but I got an error saying I had to turn on “remote access” and could only set it up while connected to my home network. Now I can’t see my camera or control my switches. These functions worked fine before I started troubleshooting the mini plug issue. The 2 mini plugs and the light switch I bought are going back to the store.

title: Decreased functionality
text:
I used to love the WeMo products. At one point I had over 20 light switches and outlet plugs. 

Then connectivity issues started happening. 

When Apple home kit released I was excited that WeMo was making a Homebridge to adapt WeMo to the iOS ecosystem.

That was a dismal failure. 

Homebridge frequently dropped devices and the WeMo app started going downhill at this time as well. 

I found the only WeMo devices with any stability were the ones branded with HomeKit compatibility.   They connect through iOS HomeKit and you can ignore the flaky and crash-prone WeMo app. 

Until you need to apply an update to a WeMo device. 

For over a year the WeMo app persistently shows “updating” but the devices never update. 

I have tried deleting caches, deleting apps, etc. but the app still fails to push through an update. 

I am very disappointed in belkin regarding WeMo. I really liked and promoted their products for years. 

I would recommend Lutron Casetta for light switches. They require a bridge but are exceptionally stable. 

Also, EVE has Bluetooth devices that are very stable. They require Bluetooth repeaters but are very stable as well.

title: Clunky to pretty darn good
text: So the Wemo smart home devices started out clunky and awkward.  But they have steadily progressed, getting better and better. Can’t blame them, new technology and many things to figure out.  Overall they work great.  App also keeps getting better.  Using these with HomeKit and I no longer have any complaints about how they work.  Good job to the company for working through the issues.  Super awesome for app to support password managers!  Thank you.  I kind of miss using the bridge for everything but that isn’t a big issue either way.

title: Devices are great, app is terrible
text: The app will eventually add the devices after a few tries and they will be added to the home app and work fine. If any of the devices lose power we the wemo app just says not detected until you remove every device and add them back one by one. Firmware updates are a nightmare to try and get done… and the home app lets you know the updates are available so home app notifications need to be disabled or you’ll always have red dots on it due to not being able to update devices that the wemo app say are not discovered. If there were separate ratings the devices working with home would get 5* and this app would get 0

title: Wait for the next update
text: I’ve been using Wemo devices for years, slowly adding light switches and plugs when I see good deals.  The app has worked without significant issue until this May/June update.  Forces you to ‘log in’.  Now only 1 of the 13 devices show in the app.  The other 12 show as unlinked.  The app asks if you want to link them but then is unable to.  Thankfully I have an older phone with the prior revision of the app.  Still works.  I can still control the devices with the Apple Home app and Alexa.  But the Wemo app? Forget it.  Customer service was friendly enough but after an hour their recommendation was to factory reset each devise and reconnect using the new app.  Worked for one devise, not for another.  I’m done!

title: Be careful of the bait and switch!
