text: Wemo sold its customers on being able to work offline without cloud connection. Now they’ve suddenly changed. You’re forced to create an account if you want to add more devices. You can’t update any firmware and if you do create an account all your switch controls must go through their servers. The round time trip is slow and so far hasn’t worked. They quietly removed their “works without internet connection”. That means if their servers go down or have maintenance, it’s impossible to control your lights. Seems like they’re slowly moving towards a forced cloud service like wink did. I’d bet money they start charging people to use their devices over the next few years.

title: Nothing about this product works
text: Bought several wemo switches and plugs and none of them work as advertised. Any time power goes out or the internet goes off you have to reconnect each device INDIVIDUALLY. Sometimes that process works, sometimes it doesn’t. For no reason. Just doesn’t. 99% of the time the remote access doesn’t work (which is why we bought them in the first place). Even resetting them doesn’t necessarily work. Customer support is non existent. Tried to send several “emails” to wemo via their app and even that didn't work! Very frustrating. These are so bad that even though it’s an expense and a loss I’m replacing all my wemo switches with TP-Link. Haven't had any problems with those. Experience has been so bad I simply won’t by ANY wemo products ever again.

title: Unreliable
text:
Half the time the app can’t detect my WeMo Insight. When it can, it’s great...but it’s a crapshoot.
**ADDENDUM**
I removed a couple of stars because my experience with Customer Service was atrocious. I reached out via Facebook Messenger. I received one message per day, with questions or information...at 2:00 in the morning. This tells me they outsource. When they could not resolve the problem, they sent my case up the line and said to expect an email. Received the email 2 days later stating they tried to call me and to please call the number they left on my voicemail. They had called the wrong number. I provided my correct number in a reply to their email. Never heard from them again. I have purchased an iHome smart plug and I love ❤️ it!

title: Just Awful
text: I have 4 wemo switches to control all my Christmas lights and one for a device I use year round. My Christmas lights have been a real pita the last two years to get up and running. My year round device has been running well and I've seen all the stability fix updates for the app that have been released, so I was hopeful this year would be different. No dice. I've been struggling to get my switches to work. I'll give up for a day and go back to it and think I'm getting close to getting one to work only to discover that one I previously had working now doesn't work. It's beyond frustrating for a device that's supposed to make your life easier. The support in the app is worthless. It's like Belkin has their head in the sand for all the issues the wemo switches have.

title: Miserable experience now requires account
text:
Used two mini plugs with only minor issues for several years. Recently tried to add a third. No exaggeration I wasted hours and 20+ attempts trying to get it to connect with HomeKit. So many time consuming factory resets, router and iPhone restarts. Waiting ten minutes for it to fail. 

Eventually used an iOS 12 device to get it to work. Something is wrong with this device and iOS 14. 

Part of my debugging was to delete and reinstall the wemo app. Bad idea. Now I must have an account to access my devices. I don’t want an account nor do I want to use this awful app. I have HomeKit and that’s enough. However firmware updates are hidden behind the required login. 

Shame on you!  I shouldn’t have to link devices in my home with the manufacturer to use them on my local network. I’m sick of it.

You’ll scream it’s for security, but HomeKit is secure and allows me to control my devices outside of the home. I don’t need your services. All I want is firmware updates.

I hope in the future Apple blocks HomeKit certification for devices that require manufacturer accounts.

title: Forced user account after 5+ years of reliable use
text:
Update June 22nd

The app makes me logon and forgets the order of my wemo devices.  The wemo device order isn’t remembered between iOS devices.

New: the app lost all my previously created rules and can’t read them from my wemo devices which still use the rules!

text:

title: Works well with a few quirks
text:
We have 7 Mini Smart Plugs. They work great. Having said that here are some complaints about the plugs and app:

1. Before I add new Wemo devices to our network I must first disable the 5 GHz radio on our wireless router. These things only connect to 2.4 GHz. When you read Belkin’s support articles on the subject it’s clear that they assume most people have different SSID’s (network names) for 2.4 & 5 GHz. However ours have the same name, as is widely recommended. This leads to me having to temporarily disabling 5 GHz. 

2. Programming the app can be a little odd. E.g. if you want to power something on from sunset to sunrise the next day, you have have to create two separate rules. This took a call to Support to finally figure out.

3. The general interface for changing settings is not intuitive to this user. But I’ve gotten used to it. 

Wemo Mini Smart Plug

title: Device efficiency

title: No longer works

title: Satisfied

title: Moving backwards
text:

I was presented with a brand new login screen, with no way to skip. Apparently I'm now forced to create an account just to get access to functionality that I had when I purchased the device. (Anonymized "Sign In With Apple" is not supported, either.)

It sounds like they couldn't even get the account signup to work properly for many folks, which gives me great confidence that they have built a reliable and secure service.

I was able to unplug the Wemo and plug it back in to get it up and running again. But I have no access to configuration changes or firmware updates. If that doesn't fix it next time, it's going into the e-waste bin.

This nonsense has got to stop. Just let us use the stuff we already paid for and leave us alone.

title: Great But Some Pro-Tips for Insight Plug

It's great because the lamp is tucked back in the corner behind our couch and we would have to crawl over the back to access the switch. Also at night when we forget to click it off, we can easily shut it off while we're already snuggled in bed. App works great! Updates every so often, but thats the norm!

title: Google Home does a much better job
text: Wemo app doesn’t detect a majority of my Wemo devices most of the time (7 of them), and refreshing or rebooting doesn’t help. Some days they are are all there in the app and are controllable, most days not. Google Home always knows Wemo devices are there and will control them. Been this way from the beginning. Very frustrating. My Philip’s Hue devices always work from their app and from Google Home. I will say that Wemo rules work even when the app is brainless.

title: Terrible
text: I’ve tried writing this review at least 5 times now. This app is so terrible that it freezes constantly. I can’t believe I have to write this again. Don’t waste your time and energy on anything Wemo. I have 4 light switches and this app loses connection to at least one every 3-4 days. I keep having to reprogram the light switches. I can’t tell you how much time I’ve wasted on this stupid app. There are so many good products out there. Stay away from Wemo. This used to be good a couple years ago but this past year has been terrible.  Save yourself the headache and purchase something good. And there is no customer service at all here. I’ve written multiple times with NO responses whatsoever. Save yourself and steer clear!

title: Doesn’t recover well during power outage
text: My WeMo plugs had been working very well interacting with both Alexa and Google Home. That is until we had a wind storm and a power failure. I was able to restore them to factory setting s and got them configured again. But it has never been the same since. Both Google and Alexa says it either can’t support turning of/on the device or says its unresponsive. Updated the firmware as one was available. Still the same results. I even reset one to factory settings again to reprogram and removed replaced the app on my phone. None of them did the trick. I’ll see if there’s another firmware update in the future that hopefully fixes these. They seem sensitive to power surges or outages.

title: Having to reset devices too often
text: I have many Wemo devices and I use schedules heavily. Recently some of the plug have started to stop following their schedules. The only way to fix this is to reset (unplug / plug back in). That would be fine, except this is happening almost once every 7-10 days. Some of these plug are in inconvenient places to keep accessing. I noticed the app hasn’t been updated in over 5 months and I haven’t seen firmware updates come through in awhile either. I can’t be the only one this is happening too.

title: This app is… ok?
text:
Knowing what I do now about support and apps, and general connectivity of the devices, I don’t know I will be buying much more Wemo product.

The application is pretty atrocious, is locked orientation, is not scaled for iPad, and the devices have connection issues with Google Home devices more than any of my other integration providers do.

I feel badly about writing such a negative review, however the fact remains that the Wemo products are not living up to the Kasa products as far as connectivity and always lag behind as far as triggering inside device groups. I’ll be staying away from them in the future.

title: Getting worse over time
text:
I have these Wemo switches and dimmers all over the house and have had them for years. Lately, they don’t work well with Alexa.  I’ve deleted and set up the skill multiple times.  Sometimes they work, but most times I have to repeat the commands. 

When the power goes out,  all of the lights on the dimmers flicker.  The only way to stop it is to flip all of the breakers to reset the Wemo switches.  

I’ve got thousands invested in these switches all over the house.  Wemo support folks are nice but useless.  I would not purchase again.  My other home has a zwave setup and it is FAR superior and very stable.

title: Difficult to move to new network
text:
It’s been a year since I moved these and the process may have improved, but it was very difficult to move to a new WiFi network when I moved last year. I had to manually reset the devices multiple times as the setup process was buggy. I work in IT and was a network admin 7 years ago, so if it’s difficult for me I imagine it will be difficult more many others. Hopefully they’ve improved on this. 
Aside from that it’s very reliable and once set up it’s fairly simple to use.

title: APP HAS BEEN BROKEN FOR DAYS
text: My smart home is a mixed environment of three different types of smart plugs. Up until last week the Wemo mini plugs seem to be the most reliable. Something very bad has broken and it’s been broken for days and we most support seems to be requesting information on a case by case basis. That’s absolutely ridiculous. I am unable to login to my account on any device and I am unable to reset my password and it has been more than seven days. I have eight mini smart plugs and they still work via Apple HomeKit and Alexa however if they don’t get this app fixed then we can’t add any new devices. Really disappointed in you Belkin, you are better than this.

title: Giving ☆☆☆☆☆ and not sure why...
text: I shouldn’t love these things for all the troubles over the years, but when they work they’re awesome. I have 4 or 5 of the older models and really liked them but at some point with all my moving, they stopped connecting. Found 3 of them the other day, plugged them in and they got back to work. I had to buy more, and love the easy setup, and really tiny size of the new models. Now I have 2 extra.

title: Works, sometimes
text:
Biggest complaint - consistency 
Adding a plug is a shell game of connecting to the plugs WiFi, opening the Wemo app, being asked to connect to the plugs WiFi, jumping to settings, realizing my iPhone connected to my home WiFi, connecting to plug WiFi, jumping back to Wemo app, Wemo app connecting to plug, Wemo loosing connection to plug with NO PROMPT telling the user what happened, starting the whole thing over again, waiting to “connect” to plug WiFi for ten minutes, finally getting one of my plug connected, starting the whole process over with a new plug. Adding the new plug successfully, oh wait, nope, it didn’t add successfully....

title: Cool Products but temperamental
text:
Generally speaking, these products are pretty cool and help a lot to automate routine tasks. I have them dotted throughout my house. 

However, periodically for no apparent reason they lose WiFi connectivity and in some cases I have to do is complete power removal and then power restore to re-establish connection. 

In contrast, I have many Signify Hue lights indoors and outside. They have rock solid WiFi connections and I don’t experience the loss of connection with them.

title: Makes light control so easy.
text: I have several and just purchased two more at Costco yesterday since they were having a special; $10. off when purchasing two. I am an occupational therapist and  a Certified Living in Place Professional and not only are they good for those that have disabilities or are older (which I am also),  but I also can use them when I am doing sensory lighting, and other environmental things in my home. They are easy to use.

title: I give it a solid Ehhhh
text: Once you get it set up, it is fairly reliable. I say fairly only because in the last year that I’ve had three different devices from switches to plug and I have had to reset it up four times. The problem is reestablishing a solid connection requires the termination because it takes about an hour and several attempts doing the same thing over and over again until something finally clicks and it begins working. This would be a better product if they can make the connection and interface easier and more reliable.

title: ““Switch not detected”
text: I’d have to say if it weren’t for what I’ve experienced, over the last two months, w/““Switch not detected,” i’d be maxing out the stars for this review. Currently, about 80 to 90% of the time, I can’t use my Wemo phone app to turn my Wemo switch off and on. Right now, is one of those times. I turned the lights on w/the app but now that I need a to shut it off before work, I can’t. I submitted the report if you weeks back, but have heard nothing. Until this bug is fixed, I don’t recommend buying a Wemo. My Wemo accommodates two, standard outlets and was purchased 18 months ago.

title: Wemo bridge firmware update process
text:
The firmware update process for a wemo bridge on an iPhone, using wemo app and Homekit is broken and confusing.  I’m running the latest iOS 14.4 and latest wemo app from the App Store.  I was told by the Apple home app that the wemo bridge has an update available.  The wemo app doesn’t actually add the wemo bridge to the app to do a firmware update on and the wemo app doesn’t say anything needs firmware updates when I have the wemo app check.

An odd solution is that at some point over night the wemo bridge has updated itself (v1.2.6) or the Apple home app doesn’t tell me the wemo bridge needs an update anymore.

title: Crap Software Integration
text: The app will decide when I can use my devices. Sometimes I have to get on my knees and pray to the digital gods so I can connect to my devices at home while I’m away. Trying to set the rules for your devices? Good luck trying to do the things you think you can do with the options they provided. Like, imagine trying to set the power threshold to detect when a device is actually running and to send me a notification when it goes idle. You’re given the option to set the value only 0-99W, the Auto Set button they have only returns 0 value instead of detecting the real power level. This is beyond disappointing to be honest.

title: One firmware update = disaster.
text:
4 wemo installed and operating in my home for months. In fact I had just recently bought two more and installed them. Was turning off the lights the other day and saw that a firmware update was suggested. Sure let's do it. 3 days later and not a single one can suddenly be identified or connect to anything. Tried to find an older version of the app as maybe that'll do it. But instead Belkin's suggestions for 'why the error may be occurring ' makes me want to throw all wemo products out the window. 

Instead I'll wait to see if any self-respecting app engineer will update this disaster and give Belkin and/or Wemo a good reputation again. 

For now, Pathetic.

title: Use to be a great app, not now.
text:
This WEMO app use to be a very good app for my appliances or lamp, now it ask me for my location each time I go to the app. WEMO I don’t think it’s any of your business where my location is when using the app. I paid for your device. Are you selling my location information to other companies or the government? Why do you need my location for your device to work?  I have a D-Link smart plug and Kasa smart plug and neither one of those apps ask me for my location when I go to their app. All 3 devices were purchased on the same day.
People you may not want to buy WEMO devices if you don’t want to give them your location.

title: Worked Great For a While...
text: I got the WeMo Insight as a Christmas gift. The setup was relatively quick and easy, and worked great for the first two weeks. But then it stopped working. I tried restarting the process and setting it up all over again so I could turn my lights in my room on and off as I walk in. It hasn't worked since and I got this LAST year! I don't even want to bother with their tech support either, I hear it's garbage. The app crashes a lot and is honestly a nuisance to run. I've lost my patience with this cruddy device and will NEVER purchase anything WeMo or Belkin, or even accept it as a GIFT. The only thing I DO like is that I can turn it on and off by touch, and that isn't anything too special.

title: Smart Home
text:
I love the convenience of having Wemo. It makes it so easy to take responsibility of the power you use in your home. He forget a light, just go to your phone and shut it off. Oh it got dark for you getting home? Love your phone and turn a light on. Away for a weekend? You can schedule your lights! It’s wonderful!!!! 
My only grip is when the Wemo lights/switches drop from the WiFi. It can be quite a pain to reconnect at times. 
That is the only reason I gave 4 out of 5 stars

title: Almost perfect.
text:
I just installed my first dimmer. The app works great but for some reason the timer and rules are an hour ahead. The timer setting will say the light will be turned off in 5 minutes until I toggle it, then it changes to 1 hour and 5 minutes. Same with setting rules. If I set a rule for an hour and 5 minutes ahead of the current time, the rule will activate in 5 minutes. Everything is an hour off. My router and iPhone times are correct.

Other than this issue the app works great. Setup was very simple.

title: Adolescent App
text:
We’ve raised just about every WeMo since their baby showers and been reasonably happy with their growth until now. But now like adolescent teenagers who threaten to turn blue, we’ve been extorted by WeMo to sign-up for a new account, and endure alexadiculous pages of reauthorizations, and disabling and re-enabling skills, just to get what was working just fine beforehand to let us access and adjust devices and timers again, because they’ve gone with a new cloud and want to harvest email addresses.

This is contrary and far more complicated than other smart switches & their apps, which simply just install, find devices, link to Alexa, and never bother you for any personal information or require you to signup for a cloud account.

Bad WeMo. The teething is too much, so we’re putting all of ours up for adoption and won’t be raising any more.

Nice product, that should remain a product and not an opportunity for marketing to harvest customer’s emails for opt-in’s.

title: Unbelievable nightmare
text: I have over 40 switches installed in my house. It has never worked reliably but I have dealt with it. Recently after a power failure all the wall switches are in infinite reboot cycles. I have many different switches and they all are blinking white or red over and over. Not going to get into it in this review but I have tried everything I could find in the manual, communities, support tier 1 and 2 with absolutely no progress. I am appalled after spending 2 grand and wasting weeks of installing and troubleshooting to just have every switch be blinking all day and no responding in the app is insane. Never been so disappointed in a tech investment in all my life.

title: Got better initially and now much worse...
text:
I have two WeMo wall plugs: one old, one new. Both constantly are “not found” via the app. Have to go to through the setup process again. Works fine for a few wejs, then not found again. 

I was given a couple of TP link Kasa wall plugs as gifts. I have since bought a dimmable bulb for a lamp as well. All 3 work flawlessly plus their app supports widgets as well. None of them ever loses its connection, can program all, as well as use via Alexa. I just ordered two more TP Link wall plugs for $10 each to replace these defective WeMo plugs that consistently lose connection.  Bye, bye WeMo.

title: Don’t Bother
text: I work for a big tech company and received the Wemo smart plug as part of a conference goodie bag. I love integrating everything tech into my home so I was very excited to try it out. The vendor demonstrated how amazing and versatile this home accessory was ..... oh boy he was wrong! I spent hours troubleshooting the WiFi connection issue that apparently most 1st gens have. Finally after multiple reboots, full power cycles, and updating firmware I gave up. Not even 2 weeks after selling it in our stores we had multiple issues with customers experiencing the same issues. We immediately pulled them out of our inventory. Not worth it until they fix all the bugs

title: I’d like to give it a 5 star.... but
text: I have 4 mini switches and they all work great thru the app.  I can turn them on or off from anywhere which is great.  BUT , when I tried to set up a schedule to turn them on or off the app will NOT let me save the schedule. It tells me unable to save try again later or check wemo devices status. This has been going on for months and unfortunately tech support hasn’t figured this problem out yet. Hopefully they’ll get it fixed and I can upgrade this to a 5 star ⭐️

title: What’s happened???
text: People beware!  I am not sure what’s going on with Belkin, but you may wAnt to think twice before investing in Belkin wemos.  Unfortunately for me I have invested heavily in switches, plugs and insight plugs and suddenly the app is crashing.  It take at least 4 or 5 times of opening the app to get it to stay open and even then it only loads half of my devices. They pop in and out of existence and it’s rare that I can use the app to actually control anything.  Alexa can control them with no issues but belkins own app cant! I am feeling so cheated and betrayed by Belkin.  Don’t be a sucker and invest in their products.  There are a ton of smart home players now a days and they couldn’t be worse than this one!!!

title: Remote Access doesn’t work, Home connectivity doesn’t work
text:
The app does work and the timers have worked but I cannot for the life of me get remote access to work or connect it to Apple Home . 
I almost got it to work once but someone called me in the process and screwed it all up . Tried several other times to reset and try again and it always times out or crashes. I got the plug in and I have my inside lights connected to it so I want to be able to tell Siri to turn on the lights and I cannot do that now . Hopefully they update it soon to work correctly

title: Works Well
text: Having installed Wemo Dimmers & Switches throughout my house, I am versed in how they work. 9/10 times I have no problems. One dimmer however did suddenly stop working. However, it was after numerous power cycling while working on home electrical outlets. Unfortunately it took multiple attempts resetting it to get it to be reconfigured, which was extremely frustrating. It was hanging on the Opening Connection screen. I hope Belkin quickly fixes this.

title: Continually disconnecting from network
text: Normally this app is terrible when it comes to the process of getting a switch to connect to my WiFi network but now it’s even worse. The switches constantly flash orange meaning they’re not connected to WiFi yet they show up in the app until you try to use the app to control them. Then they disappear. Even after going through the arduous process of resetting the switches, they only reconnect for a few minutes before starting to flash orange again. Oddly enough, the rules in place for the switches still work as scheduled so until I decide to replace them with a better quality product I will wait for an update for the app and switch.

title: Where to start
text: I have 15+ Wemo switches and plugs everything started fine at the beginning, but now the app is having some severe issues. The latest one is all the rules that I have made have disappeared all the switches and plugs are still running the rules but I can’t modify them because they don’t exist anywhere I guess I could set everything back to the factory settings, but that requires me to redo everything that I have connected to the switches (Alexa and IFTTT), and that’s going to be a pain. Also, you can’t even rate the app within the app if your keyboard doesn’t show up just saying!

title: Started out ok, but limited
text:
Initial set up was fairly easy but not exactly intuitive. However I have two homes and tried using the devices in each house. The Wemo app worked well for one house. The Apple iHome app somehow worked for the other. Except for a constant “needs updating” message, from the iHome app (took you to wemo and wouldn’t update), worked well.
However recently the Wemo app says it can’t reach the cloud server and won’t work at all, in spite of trying to reinstall. And the “hacking” reviews are disconcerting.
So, at the end of the day, it doesn’t seem to work at all at one house and only with errant “update” messages at the other house. Hence, 1 Star.

title: It Works
text: I use the WEMO Smart Plug to turn on my coffee maker before I get out of bed. Very cool to be able to have coffee waiting for me when I go to the kitchen.  My only complaint is that set up was a little wonky. Each step of the installation process hung and I had to stop it manually. Only when I restarted the app, did I learn that the installation had been successful. I have not had any problems with operation. Seems like an easy fix that could be addressed by a software update.

title: Outlets
text: The products did very well for our Christmas decorations. They came on at dusk and went till 1 AM in the morning. They came on and Turn off perfectly and in unison. Only purchased two then went back for four more. Great product dependable you do need a reasonably strong Wi-Fi and signal. No problem connecting just read the directions and follow them provided the signal they work perfectly great product would definitely recommend them.

title: Bad Wemo dimmer
text: My Wemo dimmer developed problems after about three months of use I have been on the phone with them constantly trying to correct the problem they keep sending me to someone else the last person supposedly is at the top of the chain but he got back to me and I haven’t heard from him again. Before I just could not connect It with my phone but it worked manually. Now about every three days it goes off completely and I have to reset it by turning the breaker on and off tired of this. I need a new dimmer but they don’t seem to be wanting to cooperate

title: Don’t use hyphens / App glitchy af
text: So I had been using my wemo mini switches for a while until I tried switching internets, and I tried setting them up. So first you have to completely forget the device and re set up from scratch, then it would look set up but would not connect. Then the wemo app crashed like so many times. Then I found out it’s because my wifi password has hyphens in it, then I realize it also hates the hyphen in my wifi network name. Once I removed the hyphens they set up ok, but now I can’t connect them to apple home. Pretty bummed cause all I wanted to do was switch internet, not factory reset all of them 30 times.

title: Overall- good- needs technical improvements
text: I own some heaters that need to stay powered.  I bought the WeMo plug to keep me informed in case the power would go out. However, if the entire outlet loses power,  the WeMo plugs loses power, and I don’t get a notification.  Understand, that this is a better solution than no option to know at all. When the WeMo completely loses power and then when I do check -manually- I'm informed “there are no devices.”  If this company updates the software to let me know when this happens (when devices go offline) it will be perfect.

title: Never seems to work when you need it.
text: I have 4 Wemo plugs, about 10 Kasa plugs (indoor/outdoor) and about 10+ Lutron Smart Switches and plugs. Wemo has the worst app by far, while the other two have their advantages and disadvantages. The Lutrons are accessible 99% of the time. The Kasa are accessible about 90% of the time. The Wemos are accessible about 50% of the time, if that, even though they are all about 10-20 feet from a WiFi access point. I’ll probably thrown in the towel on the Wemos and get more Kasas once they are available again. I actually started with the Wemos, which is why I never bought more than 4.

title: It just works
text:
I have a bunch of various Wemo devices around the house now, and they all work very well, including this app that controls and updates the devices.

If you’re here for the first time, then you’re likely installing new devices and if you use Apple HomeKit to connect, it makes the connect process quite seamless. 

If you have older pre-HomeKit devices, You have to put them in learn mode and search for them, but for ‘finding’ older devices, your phone running this app needs to be on the same exact WiFi network than the one you’ll want the device to use. This only started to be an issue once we all started having multiple WiFi networks and access points.

Otherwise, these things do what is advertised.

title: WEMO plugs
text: A year ago, a few months ago, even a week ago I would have give my WEMO plugs a higher rating. Last night was the final straw. None of my outlet plugs or light switches were detected in the app. This has happened on occasion with one or another of them but last night it was ALL of them. Rules were working but I couldn’t get a single light on in my dark house. How to fix it? Reset the plug! Are you kidding me?! Reset over 10 plugs/switches? Do the math, we have invested a lot on money into a product that is not reliable 100%...heck 90% of the time. ☹️

title: Sick and Tired of Wemo
text: There has to be a better solution out there than this. Fails to find devices that have been working fine for years. Unable to remove devices that have been retired. Wemo link is the biggest pain and always has been. Can’t stop Alexa from finding old Wemo devices even though they are not in the list. Apparently hidden hut not removed and no way to remove if they’re hidden. Seriously - run away. I have about six remaining devices and they are ALL going to be replaced with anything that has the slightest hint at being better than this.

title: Still great after three years
text: I’ve had Wemo light switches for my front porch and garage exterior lights for over three years and they continue to work great. I programmed them to come on at 15 min after sunset and turn off at 10pm. If we are arriving home after 10p, I can switch them on from my phone then use the wall switches to turn them off once safely in the house. I love them and convinced a friend to install them.

title: Terrible App
text: I’ve been using Wemo outlets and light switches for a long time. It was never easy to get the products connected to the app, but once you did it usually worked well enough. Recently, however, nothing is working very well. The app is incapable of erasing rules. It’s like old rules are now hard coded into some of the switches and new rules can be created in the app but don’t work in the product. And today, it’s been downloading new firmware for hours. I have 3 light switches and 8-9 plugs (3-4 original and 4-5 minis), so I have been reluctant to switch brands until today. Look for a large lot of Wemo product to appear on EBay this weekend.

title: Continues to crash, regardless of what you are doing
text: I can’t believe an app with this stability is still yet to be fixed. The app constantly crashes, while you’re setting up new device, while updating your new device, and even as I’m writing this in-app review, it crashed three times on me and won’t allow me to submit the review. What the heck Belkin?? This app might have already killed one of my Wemo plug just because it crashed while the plug is updating, and I can’t see my plug in the app anymore. I guess we just get stranded in this mess because we want the product that we have paid for to work, but with this horrible app, Idk how far we can go like this. FIX YOUR BROKEN APP

title: Frustratingly Inconsistent now
text: Initially, they worked great so I purchased two more.  About 6 months after the second pair, the Wemo app has a hard time detecting the devices, then I have to tap the on/off button multiple times on the app to turn on/off the power, then it often becomes unable to detect the Wemo device, and/or the app crashes.  Irritating.  Additionally, and this has been since day one, the “timed or scheduled” settings were not consistent; sometimes it’d work, sometimes not.  I just stopped using that function and turned them on/off remotely from the app, now that isn’t even working properly.

title: Terrific
text: I have had this app for several years and it seamlessly controls 5 outlets and a wall switch. Sometimes a little tricky to set up depending on WiFi signal strength at the unit, but since I converted to a NETGEAR multiple router mesh system it is an easy set up. The new mini plugs are an improvement over the older models. I wish an app was available for the iPad that would rotate with the screen. Other than that I would recommend others to purchase it.

title: Slowly phasing these out
text: I had the bulbs, plugs, air purifier and the cameras. They stopped supporting the cameras. The air purifier stopped working years ago. The bulbs need to be manually reset every month if not one seems to just stay on and the switches would periodically not work or turn on. I have only one bulb left and it constantly comes up grey in the app. The home app on iPhone can’t connect to it and I am using the bulb as a regular old bulb with zero smart features. If you want a led bulb that isn’t smart you should buy these up in lots bc everyone seems to be getting rid of them online. Go with a different brand and save yourself some hassle.

title: Now steals your info
text:
I’ve been using WeMo for many years but today I’m ready to remove the hardware and throw it away. One of my times switches came on at 6 am on my day off despite the schedule, and I suddenly couldn’t get into the app to shut it off and fix it.

It now requires access to my precise location in iOS to even shut the switch off remotely, after almost a decade working without it.

There is no legitimate reason to suddenly need this unless they are stealing and selling your info. The money I spent on WeMo is wasted as they have remotely bricked all my switches until I give them access to private information.

title: E.T. Phones Home
text: With the latest updates you are required to have access to Wemo’s web servers in order to login and use the product. Previously you did not have to log in because the device was already on your network. If there ever an internet outage this makes the Wemo device unable to be managed via the app as it used to be. The ability to use the device while on WiFi has also grown worse as they move to an internet dependent approach for managing the devices. I really dislike the direction that was taken here so that the company could gain additional telemetry data with the excuse of enhancing security.

title: Overpriced piece of junk
text:
I am a software engineer with some experience in home automation. 

I have several Wemo light switches and one plug. I paid almost for them almost twice the price than equivalent Kasa devices, which I purchased at the same time. Since the beginning, the Wemo devices were very often “Not detected” or unresponsive. The plug would turn on and off, by itself. The schedules would not would stop working. The application interface is not intuitive. Remote access was not reliable at all. I tried a IFTTT integration but it does no do what is supposed to do.

The worst is that since a few months ago, all devices appeared as “Not detected” in the app. I have tried all support recommendations, bur nothing has worked. Surprisingly, they work through Alexa, which seems a better interface for those devices than the one they developed.

As for the Kasa devices, nome of them have ever failed in lore than two years. And the app’s interface is way better.

title: Fantastic smart switch
text:
I have about 10 Wemo devices and they are rock solid. Very reliable and great features. I especially like the vacation mode (which fee other devices have built in). 

The only time I’ve had problems is when my home WiFi went wonky. As soon as I got my WiFi working correctly, the Wemo’s reconnected and everything was good again. 

The few times I’ve had to contact support, I got quick and knowledgeable responses.

title: Billaking
text: I have had my WeMo stuff for more than five years. I never got the second bulb to work. I have multiple devices. all work once they connect until they do firmware updates and  for me it take hours and sometimes days of trial and error to get them to connect again. I am a software developer buy occupation and don’t understand Why there are so many different methods to try to connect? The Apps support feature in settings to send problems does not let you. Most likely disabled because they have so many problems. The submit button never activates because that required field is missing the name of the product even after selecting it.

title: “So simple sounding” but NOT
text: My first device worked out of the box (a plug). Feeling some confidence, I then bought the light switch. A light switch requires a LOT more hassle to install, of course, with in wall wiring etc and OF COURSE this one simply won’t show up in the app and the support basically says restart it or reset it or turn it off and on but nothing makes it show up. Reset my firmware. Reported from circuit breaker. Grrrr. The only reason I even know this device is alive is that I can get one momentary green light to appear for a second on restart but then it goes out and I’m back in brick mode. AND I cannot even manually turn my lights on or off while I continue to troubleshoot this.

title: Worst product/app ever, wasted an hour of my time
text: I purchased the Wemo WiFi Smart plug from Costco and was excited to get it set up. I was able to discover the wemo on my phone but it would never discover my home WiFi, I tried resetting the wemo, the app, deleted it and re-downloaded, restarted the iPhone, reset the router (as you can tell I was determined to get this to work), manually entered my WiFi info about 10 times and I just never found it. So about an hour into it I gave up. Oh the app crashes many times in between all of it. The wemo will be going back to Costco tomorrow.. it looks like a call product but sad to say that I could never get it connected on my iPhone X wemo app.

title: Just OK
text: One device gives me no problems. The other won’t stay on the network despite a stable connection measured with multiple other devices in that location.  Very frustrating setup. Guides/tutorials tell you what is obvious but not what you need to know. For example, when I erased all the Wi-Fi connection data, the guide tells me the option erases the data.  But there is no guide to tell you how to reconnect it without going through another full setup.  Also won’t remember the name I rename it. Just OK product.

title: Worst “smart” devices and app ever
text: I don’t understand why Wemo is so popular. I have two Wemo devices: a light switch and a smart plug. Both devices is a crap shoot if they will come back online after a power outage. The light switch constantly disconnects from the app. I’ve tried multiple times to update the firmware via the app, and it just sits forever. Deleted the app, re-downloaded, try again. Have to constantly reset my devices. It’s a vicious cycle of failures. My Wi-Fi is strong, so it’s definitely not my internet. Worst smart device I have in my house. All of my other devices work just fine. Never buying Wemo again. Stay away.

title: These Actually Work!
text: I tried 2 other smart plugs, Meros and another brand. Could not get them to connect to my WiFi router that puts out both. 5.0 GHz and 2.4 GHz. Their terrible instructions indicated I needed to change the router settings. Good grief, no. None of my other devices needed changes to the router, they just connected as did the WeMo. The WeMo is bigger than the other plugs but it works!  The others are cute but useless.

title: Set up is Easy with Wemo
text: We had a set of smart plugs and lightbulbs from last year, but our Recent Wemo purchase was the best. Pairing the plugs was so easy and setting it up to work with our Alexa app was a breeze. We kept going back to buy more at the holidays so that we could set up routines to turn on and off our 3 different trees, the stairway garland, the mantle garland, our village collection which is on 6 different outlets, and anything else that lights up. Wemo plugs are awesome!

title: Over engineered
text:
Worked great for two years until I updated my router. Worked fine at first then a firmware update forced me to reset everything back to factory. Nightmare!  Much more difficult than when I first set them up.  After two hours of frustration I finally got it to work again.  2 stars because it does actually work once you navigate the over engineered app and interface. 

Finally, I really DO NOT appreciate being required to set up an account with Belkin just to configure a smart plug!  Borderline shady. 

I will not purchase another Belkin/Wemo WiFi  product.

title: Slow ride to failure
text:
Being an early adopter and working with their staff on the original forum, I was excited. There was a whole suite of sensors to roll out and I even have one of the elusive WeMo Makers from being part of their WeMo Inventor program. 

Sadly, two years of sporadic internet connectivity with devices has now ended in required account creation which has locked me out of accessing my devices. “Create an account,” well I did but it doesn’t work and yes, I have verified my email (or at least clicked the link). 

Does Belkin have a buy back program for my eight devices?

title: New account feature breaks everything
text: The developers need to know that the new account feature breaks everything. I lost Alexa integration and could not get it back. Devices lost detection from the wemo and took a long time to come back. And worse of all for some reason it logged me out last night and now it won’t let me log back in. Keeps saying “error try again” after I input my password. When you try to reset the password it also says “error try again” when I put in the email I used! You have completely broken the entire product and there is no way to get it back.

title: Better Options Exist
text: I have three brands of smart plugs, and they all work. This wemo mini, though, can be a headache at times. The app won't always “see” the mini upon opening, leaving me without remote control.  The app seems slow to connect to the mini in general. As others have mentioned setup can take multiple tries, and I have had to reconnect the mini to the wifi for no apparent reason a few times. It does work most of the time; but, I would recommend the other brands I own over this one.

title: Like a plane without wings
text:
First I'm having all sorts of 2.4ghz network problems.  Suddenly all seven wemo devices arent being found. When I can get their WiFi to show up the app crashes- constantly.  
Right now I want take all of these devices and run them over with my car and sprinkle the pieces in the dinner of those responsible at Belkin for this mess.
Even if I got everything reinstalled I have to recreate a couple of dozen rules and other settings 
There is no excuse for an app to crash EVERYTIME it is used.
And one other thing.. can we enter our email after the device connects?  I've entered it about a 100 times today only to have the app crash right afterwards.

title: Always a pain to set up
text:
I have about ten Wemo Mini Smart Plugs and every single time I’ve tried to set up a new one, it’s been difficult — and I’m a techie savvy person. The whole process of making a wi-fi connection to the plug, then waiting while it sets up, then switching back to your home wi-fi, is iffy.

And now (!!) I’m trying to set up a couple of them in our vacation home and it’s not working at all; the new Wemo Mini is not showing up after doing the above dance. After searching around on the net I see that maybe the whole Wemo system doesn’t support multiple households. Could that possibly be true? If so, then I’m going to have to find another solution. What a pain.

title: Don’t buy
text:
Setting this up is a nightmare. I worked on it for two days. The directions and support are of no help.   If you look for help from the Wemo people, they just keep telling you to do the same things you have already been doing even though those things didn’t work the first 50 times you did them (At least 50 times.) Google it if you don’t believe me. 

Also, I wanted these Wemo minis so I could remotely turn on my security cameras. However, when I finally got the Wemos to set up, the interference from the Wemos caused my security cameras to not work. They work fine when plugged directly into the wall but not if they are plugged into the Wemo.  Really frustrating.

title: New version w/account broke something
text:
I wasn’t able to access my mini smart plugs and thought it might be related to the recent requests to create an account. So I did. Now, the only plug Incan reliably control is the one right next to my WiFi access point. The other two are maybe 20 feet away and they’re hit or miss. Sometimes, the app sees them, but can’t control them. Other times, it can’t see them at all and offers to hide them. 

Fortunately, the Apple Home app still controls them easily.

title: Worse Product, App, & CS Support of All!!
text:
Bought this this Summer in June/July. Starting it up & setup was a breeze. But only a month later. The light dimmer no longer works. It fails to connect. The app constantly is buffering (as if its trying to connect with the device but never does). I’ve tried removing the app & reconnecting. It worked for 1 Day! That’s it!! I have tried contacting customer service several times. No one ever gets back to you. Then they send you an email stating that they are closing the complaint with no ever trying to reach out to help troubleshoot the issue. 
All & all this is the worst device, app & customer service support of all WiFi devices that connect with Alexa.

title: Very skiddish
text: This product/app is a constant source of frustration. Once it is working I enjoy it. But beware, if ever the power goes out or you bump the plug, you have to go through the setup process again. And because you did it once the app is really confused and unusable at trying to fix it. I have been able to get it working again but this last time it thinks my plug is updating, but it is not even plugged in and hasn’t been for a while. I try to remove it and it won’t let me. I try to restart the app and nothing changes. I tried to factory reset and it still thinks I am updating it. Horrible app and process.

title: It Works
text: The app and the product work well, I guess. They function for the most part, but there have been a number of times where the app loses connection to the lights. It’s not easy to reconnect them, for some reason. For reasons, I feel uncomfortable to explain, this becomes a problem. When I’m trying to go to bed, I can’t turn off the light when this happens. Thank goodness I needed to program the light to turn on for a few minutes in the middle of the night or the light would never turn off during the night.

title: Crockpot could be a little better
text: I downloaded the app IOT use with a WeMo crockpot as it is a necessary for our busy family life and it is FANTASTIC. The ability to prep the crockpot before hand then turn it on when needed ensures our family dinners are fresh and delicious, ready to eat when we arrive home and not a soggy mess since it’s been sitting on warm for hours. The ONLY thing that would make this better is if I could preset the time that the crockpot started so that I wouldn’t have to go out and start it.

title: Not reliable
text: I bought Wemo light switches for my condo about 2 years ago.  Light switches look really nice and work well for day to day manual operation.  The app and voice control (Alexa) worked well for about 3-4 months.  Then the app stopped recognizing the devices, had to reinstall the app and the devices several times.  System works on and off.  Now the app does not recognize the devices or takes 2-3 min to do so.  Wemo does not work with Alexa.  I have tried everything, reinstalled the app 10 times, set up the switches several times, turn power off and on in my unit, watched several videos online from Wemo regarding troubleshooting, nothing works.  Will not buy Wemo again.

title: Improve scheduling
text: It’s confusing. You have 3 choices: “on/off” and “on” and “off”. So if you go to “on” and set a time and then “off” to set time they override each other (I.e. you must choose “on/off” option to set both). But that is not intuitive to me. Your eyes go to yes I want to start setting an on time and then to yes I want to now set an off time. While I see the thinking of the “on/off” simplifying accomplishing that, if one starts with my assumption then you I keep trying the over and over and getting nowhere. Probably better to allow one to also set the on off if they chose to start with the “on” choice.

title: Use to love, now I’m ready to toss
text: I have used my Wemo devices for years, but with the recent updates now I can’t use them. I even deleted the app off of my phone and reloaded it. Now the app just shows ‘looking for devices’ and I can’t find them. My sister is able to still use it and she didn’t do the update so I don’t want to have to try resetting all of our devices and not have them work. This app has always had a bug or two that you have to work through, but this one has been the worst one yet for me! Guess I’m finally done with these...

title: Devices good, App terrible
text: I quit buying Wemo devices because the App just cannot keep contact with them. I add a new device and within 24 hours the App cannot find it. Fortunately, the Alexa app can. That tells me that communications from the device to the Wemo server are working fine but the App cannot keep up. I have switched to Kasa devices which work perfectly. Its a shame since I have 10 Wemos still. And God forbid you ever need to reset your wifi password. That requires reinstalling each device. What a pain! The App should be able to handle that easily. <rant over>

title: Plugs stopped working after Internet outage
text:
The last update fixed an issue with my Wemo plugs being inoperable for the last month. However now the plugs will not connect after an internet outage was resolved and the Xfinity router was rebooted. Before I was dealing with support by email but now my email was returned with a message that this way of communication is no longer supported. Must use chat. I was going to buy more Wemo smart devices but with all the issues with the app will look at other brands.
Update: With last app update the smart plugs are now connecting to app.

title: Save your money
text: Never written a review in my life. Doesn’t work at all, app crashes constantly. To set up a new device is virtually impossible. Some how I managed to get one to work out my old place, but after moving same issues I have had with the other ones. Impossible to reconfigure. I have had the device over a year with the same problems and the app hasn’t been updated once and nothing has been done to solve the countless problems people are having with this device. So unless you enjoyed being constantly frustrated with what should be a simple to use product. Save your money, because this company doesn’t care about it.

title: Lousy app
text: This app is very clunky and slow, a real pain to use! I am very tech savvy, and a programmer myself. Junk software like this annoys me. While my outlets seem to work (just the first couple of days after the installation, fingers crossed), the app itself is ridiculous. Poor interface, simple operations such as saving and refreshing the rules/schedules take FOREVER, and may not even ever complete! That’s with the full WiFi signal. So, both the app UI and back-end implementations are crap. Shame. I have installed the app on the iPad that is mounted on the wall in my hallway and controls all my house devices. The app doesn’t switch to the portrait mode, it seems, so it’s always sideways on that iPad...

title: Working but took a few tries
text: Set up outlet plugs. Wanted something to integrate with arlo cameras and these can be tied together to function through IFTTT filters .  Tried several failed attempts to get them up and running and was getting frustrated. These plugs will only connect to a 2.4 Ghz wifi . We were set up on 5Ghz with everything and they did not work . Switched over and now working properly. Not enough information in the set up instructions to solve the issue I gad to do research .

title: FIRMWARE update failure that never ends
text: Beware. I have used WEMO devices for years now and I dread the firmware update notification that shows up on all my phones and iPads. The update appears to complete but my devices just keep telling me to update. I am on month three now and I go ahead and try the update almost every day to no avail. The notice that takes over the entire screen continues every time I start the app. Eventually the notices will end after I endure months of distress dealing with this. Their software is just buggy as hell. Update: still not fixed after close to a year of not updating. Now I want to get the new Bridge but without updating not likely to work.

title: Saves electricity
text: Ever since we found out that our COMCAST box consumes an extraordinary amount of electricity even while off, we purchased a Wemo to control the plug in strip which completely shuts off the electrical power to it. And we connected it to Alexa which makes it easy to just say, “Alexa, turn off TV”. It does take about 5 minutes for COMCAST to boot up but the electricity saved from the box not being always “on” makes it so worth it.

title: Not So Great
text:
Can't believe how difficult it was to set-up and the software upgrade took forever.

After spending an hour on the phone with some Indian women who was reading off of a script I hung up and sought the internet for some help. Got it up and running on my Google network by unplugging all but the main modem and then plugging in the others when I had finished.

Firmware update took over 20 mins and quit several times. Not that impressed Belkin.

title: Barely works most of the time
text: Activating new Wemo plugs with the app is terrible, especially if you have poor LTE reception. I’ve wasted hours setting up three of these things with the app, and once they were finally set up they are really unreliable. One thing that’s especially bad is that the app doesn’t seem to be able to talk to the plugs if your phone is connected to a 5ghz network, EVEN IF that network is on the same router as your 2.4ghz network. Every time I want to use the app to control my Wemos I need to manually switch networks. It may be that my router is misconfigured, but it really shouldn’t be this difficult.

title: Frustrated!!!!
text:
I have spent well over a thousand dollars on their equipment for my home. Now, most equipment won’t function because of the poor functionality of the App. Some of the items are now permanently disabled. This is so frustrating.

Belkin just stopped it’s cameras from working. I don’t mean they have stopped while they fix the app, they stopped the cloud service that supports the cameras. Translation the four cameras I bought are now just paper weights. 

I am very concerned. I hope this is not the planned outcome for the rest of the Wemo gear portfolio. Who knows. I’d be very cautious buying any more Belkin or Wemo gear without demonstrated stability.

title: App is terrible and never gets improved
text: Through the years I have dealt with the poor quality of this app, and last year, when it finally became possible to control Wemos with Apple Home, I rejoiced because it mostly didn’t have to deal with it. Now that they have introduced Wemo accounts, it has gotten worse to be honest. I can’t even connect new Wemos to Apple home any longer! What’s worse, after switching to the account, the Wemo app itself lost ALL of the existing Wemos, even though they continue to work with Apple Home. This app is dreadful, and if I didn’t have a significant investment in Wemos, I would be ditching it.

title: New app doesn’t work unless
text:
For iPhones and iPad. Go to iPhone settings, iPhone storage, Wemo app, offload, then delete app. Then go to App Store reinstall app. Answer location question, and notifications setting. Then you are good to go. You must create an email / password account with Wemo for the new app. It would have been nice to be warned about this before the upgrade.

Changed to 5 stars because now it works.

title: New update destroyed everything.
text:
I previously had 4 Belkin devices working well for 2 years. Got a pair of new Wemo minis and had to update app and also firmware and nothing worked after that. I tried Apple airport, netgear 900 and Ubiquiti wireless devices set only on 2.4 G (turned off 5 G) over 3 days. App keeps crashing. Either it connects to Wemo device or to WiFi, but is never able to transfer off from Wemo to WiFi for success connection. All other 2.4 devices are all working fine. None of the 6 Wemo plugs are working and the fault is in this app and the device firmware. 

Good riddance for now. Never again!  Apple is there a way to give a rating of minus five star? Wemo has earned it!

title: App deserves zero star
text: This app is totally unpredictable. It will operate fine and then one day decides it will communicate with some of the wemo devices and not others. Talked with customer service and after days and weeks of trouble shoot there is still no solution.  The app is totally erratic on what it chooses to detect. Thankfully the wemo switches are also connect to my google home. That works 98% of the time (and there are days that the gooogle home will not be able to find a certain wemo switch too). The problem is if I want to set a automated program I still have to do that on the wemo app. I probably would not choose the wemo platform to automate my home if I have to do it again.

title: Works great for me
text: I have had  several mini plugs and switches controlling lights inside and outside my house for a couple of years now. The only time that I have had an issue was when I changed routers. The original setup instructions were nowhere to be found but the online instructions got me going quickly enough. Overall, I am quite pleased with the product.

title: Solid
text:
This little device turns my heat on in my office and automatically turns it off twice a day in case I forget to do so manually. I love it. 

Had to call support for the first time in 5years today. I cynically expected to be told to go take a hike.  They were professional and solved my problem, even after so many years and for what was probably a $30 device. Thank you!

title: Threw the wemos in garbage
text:
After using them since 2015, trying the latest hardware, app, and firmware, I gave up.  In any one week, at least one (or many more) device fails and needs local resetting, or factory resets. The blinking yellow light of failure. Wemos are unreliable, will probably always be unreliable, it's clear to me Belkin will not fix them and I’m just tired of it.  

Look, I know what I’m doing, being an engineer and all. I own two houses, on two separate networks, both with high end and stable routers.  Both houses have Wemo stability issues. Some apps or firmware releases better, some worse.. never meeting expectations. 

Asking for the new log in and position tracking was the last straw.  Bought Kasa TP link's smart switches, and couldn’t be happier. 100% reliable for 6 months now.  

My Wemo days are over.. if you’re considering a smart switch, don't use Wemo. Buggy app, no privacy, buggy cloud management, buggy hardware firmware. Belkin's Wemo product is a zero.

title: Unreliable.
text: I bought two WeMo smart plugs a number of years ago and they seem to work just fine. Within the past couple years I added two more and ever since then I have had nothing but problems with the smart devices. One or more is consistently getting dropped from the network, the name disappears on the app and/or I have devices turning on and off at random hours even though they’re set to a time scheduleI. I keep all of my devices and firmware up-to-date but I am at my wits end and have decided to redo all of my smart plugs with a different brand. This is not a very reliable or stable device.

title: WHAT HAPPENED?
text: I haven’t used WeMo for a year.  I was excited to get the system back up and running in my new home only to find out it’s basically useless as far as unattended use operation is concerned.  I was sad and to find out that this application the latest revision is buggy and makes it impossible to set the days during a timing cycle whether it is a program to go on or off you can do it for the time but it’ll say daily however you can no longer select a given days I’ve checked a number of options etc. and it will not work on any of my devices which makes this place pretty useless Unless you just wanna operate things manually.

title: Unnecessary PII required
text:
You used to be able to use this app without an account. Now you are forced to create an account and proved personally identifiable information. This information is not, and should not, be required to used an app that is necessary to use devices I already paid several hundred dollars for. If this had been the case when I bought the devices I would have returned them immediately. Now I’m stuff having to work around not being able to use this app because Belkin pulled a bait & switch in us.

Until they implement Sign In with Apple, this app is 100% useless garbage.

title: 4 Stars
text: I bought a Mini a few years ago and I had issues that required tech support and it was a terrific rep who stayed with me on the phone for an hour until we decided to just swap it out. The replacement worked fine ever since so I jumped on a 3 pack to replace the old analog timers for things. They were a lot easier to set up now that I had the prior learning experience with the Mini. Recommended for great phone support.

title: HORRIBLE!!!!! DON’T BUY
text: I’ve been putting up with these switches for a year now. Obviously I’m a patient person. The connectivity is horrible. Too many steps just to get it to work and then it stops working a few days later. It takes at least 15 minutes to connect everything again and that’s only when it works. Most times it takes longer and I have to run through the steps several times. I bought these so I wouldn’t have to be inconvenienced to reach over behind the bed to turn on a couple of bed lights. Its been way more inconvenient and time consuming to deal with these Wemo switches. I learned my lesson, being lazy didn’t pay.

title: Wishful Thinking
text: Two WeMo mini switches. One set up fine and is working as expected. The second disappears, won’t work and shows “not detected”. Yeah firmware and app was updated. Router is strong and updated. Reset the rogue device...  went through tortuous cycles of trying to reset and get it to connect ... when the other switch was a breeze. All in all I can’t rely on it to work reliably any time I’m away from the house which is pretty much the time I need to rely on these devices. Otherwise it works OK when I’m in my home on my WiFi. Usually. I have remotes for that not 30 buck on/off switches so... fail.

title: One of the best things in my house.
text: I don’t get when people write bad review on a product they couldn’t get to work for them. (Read the instructors) I love my Wemos.  We have a total of 6 and they all work fine.  No troubles what so ever.  I got to setup two and my two kids did the other four.  Put a little time and effort and the reward will pay off.  We love this product and we will continue to outfit our home with Wemo devices.

title: Worked great, until it didn’t.
text: I have several of the light switches, which worked great for a few years.  Now they go undetected, which is a big problem when I’m out of state.  The rules that I set up for the lights to go on and off when away from home aren’t working and I have no way of correcting that remotely.  I’m going to switch to a different brand because this isn’t working for me anymore.  The developers need to fix this problem, but it looks like others complain about this issue too and nothing has been done to correct it.  Too bad, because they used to be great.

title: My how far you've fallen...
text:
I used to love these things but now they are so buggy I wouldn't recommend them to anyone.  The new model plugs won't connect to thier own app much less connect to the home app.  I can get my older non QR ones to connect to the app but when you try to sync the wemo app with the homekit app it all falls off the rails. 

When you look at the resources they give for troubleshooting it tells you to click on banners that don't pop up which makes the troubleshooting process useless.  Or I reinstall the app and loose all my other working WeMo devices stored in the app.  It never just works.

I'm pretty technically inclined.  I'm a dang network engineer.  If I can't get it to work easily it's too complicated for the normal end user.  

And because these things used to be such great devices I hurt giving such a poor review but as of today half my wemos are worthless and I'm ready to move on to something else.

RIP wemo it's been real.

title: Disappointing cloud tie in
text: I opened this app after having not used it in a while and found I was forced to create an account and verify my email address if I wanted to continue controlling my light switches from the app. The previous functionality of controlling your lights over WiFi is not available until you create an account. Of course the “marketing offers” checkbox is pre-selected when you give them your email address. Disappointing to prioritize their marketing ability over functionality that worked previously. Poor product decision that adversely affects the user experience.

title: Least reliable product ever!
text:
I got it working so I know I set it up right, but three fourths of the time something in the App prevents it from working. Total waste of money.
Either the device doesn't show up, or it stays grayed out, or nothing happens when you select it, and trying to set up any rules the screen just sits there. Then magically once in a while it works. My lousy old X10 works far better than this.

Update September 2019 it’s been several years. There have been zero improvements with this product. I’m stuck using it because it’s one of the only products available which mystifies me. They still don’t have any 240 V appliance control products or dimming capability. How they are still in business is a mystery to me.

Update May 2020. Still no improvement. Today it kicked me out of the app and when I try to sign back in , it acts like I’ve never had an account. I’m done. Switching to Kasa. Belkin products get an “F”

title: Difficult, never worked
text: I am not a techy, but I can run my way around my settings and WiFi page, download and app, and set up new Wemo. At lease that’s what I thought. I originally ordered two Wemos, they worked after a difficult setup, however when I brought four more, the app told me I needed a firmware update. After that nothing ever worked again. I deleted the app, and redone loaded it twice, reset all the Wemoa to factory default at least twice and on and on.  While the Wemos kept blinking two color lights, the app in two separate devices, never could find them anymore. I um plugged them and returned them all

title: Buggy, regret purchasing
text:
I don't usually write reviews but after trying to setup my smart plug for the past hour and a half, I felt compelled.

My story is quite similar to the other reviews: tech savvy, own other HomeKit devices, but yet the basic setup of my WeMo mini smart plug has proven impossible.

This app crashes my iPhone during the setup process. Not just crashing the app, actually crashing the whole phone. That's impressive.

I don't really like my iHome devices. They're unstable and will lose connection fairly often. This is the reason I tried a new brand.  For all their problems, they were never as bad as this Belkin product, which is a huge surprise to me. 

I regret the purchase but already tore up the package too much to return it.

title: When it works, it works very well
text:
Normally these devices work very well and I really like them. However when the devices need an update this is where it goes off the rails in my experience. I agreed to an update over 2 hours ago - and every device is in a “doom loop” of updating and not responding at all. 

The cheery prompt is to “update and keep your devices happy” (something like that). What about my happiness and satisfaction with these products? 🤷‍♂️

This has happened before but I don’t remember how I got them out of it. Unplug and plug back in, reset doesn’t do it. Maybe I will take careful notes this time. 😕

UPDATE: rebooted the router and everything came back immediately. I upgraded to a 5 star rating - normally I am quite happy with these devices.

title: Used to be great
text: After using Wemo for about 5 years without many hiccups, performance has taken a nosedive in recent months. Devices are frequently not recognized, the time zone in rules inexplicably shifted 2 hours, etc. I have spent numerous hours reinstalling the app, rebooting and resetting devices, researching issues online. Bottom line is that Wemo is supposed to be a time saver, not a waste of time. Lately it has become the latter. I have 6 Wemo devices with 4 installed switches, so I’m still hoping that is temporary, but if this continues then I’ll just have to replace them with devices which work reliably. It’s a shame to see what was once a leader in this market go downhill.

title: Will not stay open
text:
Crashes over and over again for about two weeks. Tried resetting it, still unresponsive. Help WEMO.

Update:  Still not working!  Called Wemo customer service gave my name and number, in case we got disconnected.  Rep asked a few questions but mostly sat there in silents while she was doing something behind the scene. After about 20 minutes I was disconnected, no call back, email nothing! I didn’t call back as it is a pain jumping through all the AI hoops and I would have to start all over again with a new Rep. Come on Wemo let your customers know what’s happening at least.

title: Loses connection W/devices at least once a week
text: I have several Wemo smart plugs in the house, and I have to reset and reconfigure them every single week after they suddenly stop responding, and the app stops seeing them. Every time this happens you have to repeat the slow and awkward process of setting the smart plugs up with the network, trying several times before they actually get connected. Sometimes they never do, and you have to delete and reinstall the app. This software - the app and the one that runs on the devices - is all garbage. Waste of time. Absolutely hate it!

title: It’s ok, could and maybe will be better
text:
The app interface is the weak point of the system. I’m always confused when I make a rule If the rule is actually running or not. And I’ve been burned manually turning on or off a light pushing the button on the plug and discovering it overrides the rules. 

Creating rules is laborious and time consuming. It should be much easier. I should be able to copy paste, etc. I’d do more with the rules but it’s annoying to figure out and change with this app. 

Just recently we temporarily lost internet and now the app is saying it can’t find the plugs. The plugs are still working and running as programmed but I can make changes unless I go through the whole reconnecting process again. 

If these bugs were remedied and the app was cleaner and easier to use I’d be amazed with the product.

title: Disappointing to say the least
text: I have them all through my home. Sorry I invested so much in this brand. Recommended to friend, they ordered one and hated it. Mine only in the last two or three months have gone crazy and most every day I have to reset them. Resetting them is a pain. Don’t know what happened but the apt is useless. Don’t tell me my signal is low. This only just started and I have added numerous WiFi extenders for this problem.  Seriously considering taking the loss and switching to a more reliable brand. As I type this my switches are once again flashing yellow.  DO NOT Recommend this brand.

title: Junk.  Absolute junk.
text:
It is inconceivable to me that, to this day, after innumerable customer complaints, threads, etc. spelling out the Wemo app’s refusal to allow users to program on/off times (which they call “rules”), and several revs of the app later, this STILL DOESN’T WORK.  Tried all steps recommended by manufacturer, and results were same as reported by others:  fail!

This will never be fixed, because manufacturer has clearly made a deliberate, conscious decision not to fix it, just as I’m now making a deliberate, conscious decision to pitch this junk and switch to Apple Home.  Screw you, Wemo, and good riddance to bad rubbish.

title: Easy Peazy Lemon Squeezy
text: Just put in my third light switch. Now I’m ready for winters out of town. The app and the installation went smoothly and the guide in the app was intuitive and best of all, it worked!  I recommended to my friend who has a neighbor come over daily when he’s gone to turn the lights on and off. Now he can do it from Florida and not have to buy his neighbor a gift for the effort.

title: Wemo Switch
text:
I’m extremely impressed with this product!  I was able to install this product myself w/ no electrical experience. 
The range on this switch with my WiFi is amazing!  Its located at the very end of my house where WiFi is the weakest but it works!  
Outside Lights come on automatically with sunset and go off at 3am (the way I want it!). 

It just works!  Plain and simple!  Highly recommend. I’m not affiliated with this company!

title: Disappointed
text:
I have had four light switches for  about a year. ThEy were easy to install and worked pretty well unless there was a power failure or you had to reset your Wi-Fi. I added two Wemo mini switches recently and they are a nightmare.
Most of the time nothing shows up on the app, Alexa cannot connect and it takes hours talking to a rep to get everything done because the app is junk. The reps are only slightly better than the app.
If I weren't already invested in these I would buy a different brand for sure, still debating whether I can swap them out
Avoid if possible

title: Do Buy!
text: All Wemo devices need to be set up in a “”specific order.””  If you do not you will have a heck of a time. I had to call their customer support and all my wemo bulbs,hubs wemo link wemo switches, and two way cameras were set up in just a few minutes...I love this stuff. I could not believe how easy it actually is! Just Follow the directions, I’m tech savvy as well and still had to call customer service. Once you learn, it’s Easy!

title: Sorry I bought them
text:
Purchased approximately 20 switches in Costco.  
Had an electrician install them. Started out working great. 
The software leaves a lot to be desired.  Not intuitive to use. Have some switches from Feit Electric and some Lutron Caseta switches , their software is significantly better.  
Hardware issues.  
Switches start flashing red and totally not working. 
Call tech support and they tell you to shut off the circuit breaker and then restart. 
Had to replace the switches. 
Come home today and switches are flashing red again. Some of the switches are just not being recognized by the app. 
Have to spend another hour or so with tech support. 
They may be the least expensive switches, but you get what you pay for. 
Will have the electrician come again and trade out all the switches. 
Would have been better off paying for a better quality switch then paying the electrician twice for each switch 
All going back to Costco.

title: App Notifications Stopped Working
text:
The app works for the most part, but several versions ago I stopped receiving notifications via the app when events occur.  I have a Wemo Maker with the sensor setup.  The sensor shows triggered and not triggered when I go into the app.  I created a rule to send a notification when the sensor is triggered and not triggered.  I no longer receive these notifications.  I’ve tried reinstalling the app without any success.  Please bring back the notifications.

Thanks

title: 7+ year wemo user. Used to love it
text:
I was a huge wemo supporter, great devices, pretty good support, but holy smoke did they drop the ball on this.  Ever since they moved to a cloud setup it’s been nothing but trouble.  Devices show wrong status, some rules no longer work, some timers no longer work, the list of annoyances and problems goes on and on.  
Every once in a while the app will just decide to log you out, ok, well, when you log back in the order of your devices is all messed up, so you’ve got to spend time ordering them.  
And it’s 2021, why is there no support to log into the app with face recognition????

title: Accounts rollout *not* ready for primetime.
text:
You say you're enhancing security with accounts, yet you:
