(1) don't support password managers like Keychain, 1Password, etc., which is an extremely simple API;

(2) have very poor support for special characters (let alone the fact that you waste our time by failing to define the rules in the first place (which isn't less secure if you have proper rich support built-in); and 

(3) don't offer multi-factor authentication of any kind. 

At this point I wouldn't be surprised if you stored passwords as plain text. 

Also, following account creation I was bounced back to login. No notification about account creation success, verifying email, etc. I was able to log in and then I saw a persistent prompt to verify email. I did and I was bounced back to the app, which still told me to verify. I logged out and in and I'm still being told to verify. Delightful. 

Oh, and none of my 21 WEMO devices are being found. Fun.

title: Doesn’t let me turn off light without access to my location. Really?!
text:
I just launched the app to turn off lights in my bedroom and it popped me with a prompt requiring to access my location. Why? Why I cannot just turn off the switch?

I got this one belkin wemo switch long time ago. Then decided to keep more of lutron switches since they support apple home and at the time Belkin wasn’t. But I don’t like that those lutron switches have 4 buttons instead of one with a slider. So I was looking around and wemo’s new dimmer switch looked attractive. But I guess of you require access to my location to use your app - I won’t. That’s just not nice of you.

title: Almost perfect
text: These are fantastic and the app is pretty good too. The only downside is that for some reason the Wemo app doesn't have a widget I can put in my "today" screen for easy access - there are other apps that do but they're not free. Seems like a simple feature. Also, you can't configure them with Siri without some odd pricey Apple HomeKit accessory. If I had some near instantaneous way of controlling the switches without opening the app (either widget or siri) this would be 5 stars.

title: Location Required
text:
Update: this is “fixed” but now requires an account. They have an option to work without an account, but that still requires location access. I think the blatant data mining is reprehensible and am leaving this at 1 star. 

We have a WeMo switch that actually works quite wonderfully. The reason for this 1-star review is that their app recently updated and requires Location access in order to function. There’s absolutely no need to make Location access mandatory to use a smart switch... will leave as 1 star until it’s fixed.

title: Requiring an account made it impossible to set-up new device
text:
I had set-up and used several WEMO devices successfully for more than a year with this app. When trying to set-up a new device, the app said I needed to create an account. No problem I thought, and I set one up. After confirming my email address to activate the account, I tried logging in only to be greeted with a bad username/password message. I have attempted using lost password to reset the password several times over several weeks always with the same results.

My unconfigured WEMO smart plug is sitting useless on my desk and after waiting on hold for a half hour to talk to support with no answer things are now worse but I keep trying. 

Yesterday and Today, the app tells me it can’t contact the WEMO cloud and to check my internet connection. The same connection that is currently working for all other apps!

WEMO needs to get their act together.

title: “Remote access? New account method?” Both don’t work
text: First off, the “remote access” does NOT work at all. I have tried to access the lights from down the street and my wemos have no detection at all. Second of all, the new account method does NOT work at all either. I created an account and tried to log in- I received an error message. I tried to reset it- I received an error message. I even tried to create another account- error message. Really? Frustrated... please fix! Might have to look into another company that offers similar or better services if this isn’t fixed ASAP.

title: Needs to be optimized for iPad!!!!
text: The app has worked out great for controlling my wemo devices and setting switch timers. however it it missing a ton of features with device settings. Like if it goes offline it will give you the option to hide it but not reset WiFi! Which comes to the lack of support for an iPad app! This should be there because people with iPads do not want to look at a cropped screen like me. So forget doing that. This is why it is frustrating!

title: Starts off great....then reality hits all new lows
text:
Bought one dimmer and fell in love with the product. Proceeded to purchase 5 more after about a weeks’ worth of use. After about a month, one dimmer failed to connect while another separate dimmer was stagnant and wouldn’t respond via the app. I tried customer service and all they wanted was a copy of my receipt which I did not have. Went down hill after that and have had little luck ever since. Word to the wise, keep your receipts if you want any type of service. And be ready to wait two weeks for a replacement or shell out extra cash in order to get one shipped faster. 

Painful.

title: Do not buy this product
text: I purchased several WeMo Mini switches to use around the house and I regret the investment. Setup is overly complicated and extremely buggy. If I attempt to do any customization of the switch (i.e. renaming) the setup process fails and you have to start over. If you’re lucky to get though the setup process (I have four switches and after several days I have only managed to get one working) the switches themselves are completely unreliable. The other day I came home to find the switch blinking yellow. Apparently it has disconnected from my network and needs to be setup again. No thanks. Mine are going in the trash.

title: Kept saying my network password was incorrect and wouldn’t connect
text: At first everything connected smoothly. Then it ran a firmware update and all heck broke loose. Spent 2 days trying to reconnect to my WiFi and it kept saying my password was incorrect. Reset unit, reset router, double checked passwords, everything I could think of. I even changed my WiFi to a non secure setting to get it to work. Finally, it connects out of nowhere and I’m not sure it’s going to work properly. Fully expecting once I switch my network back to secure that it won’t work again. Pretty sure firmware patch screwed up everything but there’s no option to redo that.

title: Login feature
text: I liked the Wemo product when I first got it as a gift a couple of years ago.  It definitely makes life easier!  Lately I have to login in order to make my lights turn on;  I don’t like this new feature to the product!   I use a stylus to type and don’t always have one handy.  It is very frustrating to have to login now to make my Wemo switches work!  Why did you change it?

title: My WEMO Applications
text:
I am currently operating six WEMO INSIGHT SWITCHES from three different locations. My WEMO devices have been in service for nearly one year now. I have found all four switches supported by two different WIFI connections to perform flawlessly. 

I really utilize and appreciate the power and time monitoring feature as upgraded from previous remote switches that I have used. 

The WEMO product appears to update its Firmware more often than other wireless devices that I am familiar with. I credit the frequent updates with the product's reliability and my overall complete satisfaction.

I would highly recommend the WEMO INSIGHT SWITCH device for use with any reliable remote WIFI location in applications up to 1,500 watts at 120  VAC.

Mike Poole
Updated February 18, 2018

title: The simplest features don’t work
text:
Can’t save local electricity costs.  The app will always default back to 0.111..whatever, so the cost figure can’t be trusted.  

The daily reports have, after a few days started reporting a negative number of kWh per interval.  And again, the report is stuck on 0.111..blah blah kWh so you have to go in and tweak every report. How hard would it be to get this right?  It’s a major feature for me that is a letdown.  

Also, it would be nice to have the ability to export an .xslx file with the formulas.  At least that would make the job of of fixing the kWh bug slightly easier.

title: Not compatible with multi-frequency Wi-Fi. Use HomeKit instead
text:
WeMo devices work well when installed via HomeKit, so there is no real need for this app, and there is one big downside to it.  If you install it and you have a multi frequency network, you can constantly lose connection to your WeMo devices.  There appears to be some incompatibility occurring between this app and HomeKit.  The problems only occur when this app is installed, so I recommend avoiding it.
Without the WeMo app, however, you will not be able to install firmware updates, and may have to put up with an annoying reminder from HomeKit.

title: Please fix HomeKit integration.
text:
I have two Insight plugs—Climate Control and Espresso Machine. For the second time, HomeKit integration failed. Climate control in HomeKit turns on the espresso machine but not the space heater, though both show up as “On” in HomeKit. I’ve spent hours on the phone with tech support having to fully remove, restore, and reset everything. 

As best I can tell, an update is released that bricks HomeKit functionality. Then you go through the process of fixing things. Then another update comes out and bricks it again. 

Developers, please debug before deploying!

title: Wemo never fixes known issues for years
text: So why has it been an issue for years where the app shows al my plugs as active, I got to press one of them to either ON or OFF and instantly the plug goes to "Not Detected" it stays that way for 24h (Denial of access to the plug). When you call the support line the only solution they have is to remove the plug from the wall and plug it back in... So how do I do that from 300 miles away??? Logging in/out of the account does nothing. Tech support is pathetic. Please fix your everyday BUGS in your APP!!!!! Its not appropriate for you guys to have bugs like this that happen EVERYDAY!!!!

title: Firmware Updates need work
text:
The app is clean overall, but updating firmware is a pain. It gets stuck a lot and you need to power cycle everything constantly to keep it connected to HomeKit. There should be a note saying the last time updates were checked, notifications when an update is available per devices and automatic updates. 

My dimmer and two switches work great with the app and automations but can not connect to HomeKit. Very frustrating.

title: Do NOT! Update to 1.25 if you want your stuff to work
text:
They have now made it mandatory for you to have a Wemo account for your plugs/switches to talk to before the app will register them to your network.

After spending several hours setting up a new account and then several more hours resetting my password because the password rules are not posted I finally got one of my outlets to register in the app.   But, it is not ‘found’ in the cloud... is that because it is being controlled via HomeKit over my wemo bridge?  It’s hard to say.
 Do yourself a favor and check the support community before updating to see if the stuff works before updating.   
 It is sad because Belkin used to be a trusted Mac / Apple vendor and now this experience is a dumpster fire.
I’m going to bed for now and will mess with this again in a few days.  Im hoping there will be another update or their support group will know more of what is going on by then.

title: Do not purchase for HomeKit!!
text: Purchased Wemo mini plug, can call it smart, to go with HomeKit.  Got the product home plug in got it synced with Wemo app, this was simple. When trying to connect to HomeKit, the app told me to update the plug, hit the update button and “Nope, nothing new today”. Spent some time on support pages, did everything that I could find, nothing. Called support, did all the same stuff, a level 2 will call you tomorrow. Level 2 calls, do all the stuff over again, “Nope, nothing new today”. After spending two hours trying to get plug to connect to HomeKit, told the tech I was going to return the plug, “ok have a great day sir” and was hung up on.

title: Works with the Wemo App but not with Apple Home
text: I installed two Minis and they work just fine. I can control them with the Wemo app. But when I tried to integrate them with my Apple Home App, only one of the two was recognized by the Apple Home App and Siri could not control either one — even the one that appears in the Apple App. A call to Apple was useless. I have not yet been able to call Belkin — and they do not have a “chat” function for this product or take emails. You need to clear time for the endless wait on the phone.

title: Reliable Rules
text:
Bought a wemo light switch for my home. I had it set on a timer so, when I went out of town, my  lights would still turn at regular intervals. It worked very reliably. Lost 1 star cause, when I tried to hook up my wemo to the internet, there was a bug in the app that would prevent it from connecting unless the 'remember internet preferences' switch was off.. that took me a half hour to figure out.
Overall, great product and I'm very happy with it

title: It works! Others often don’t
text:
In ‘rules’ app should default to the location, day, time set do you don’t have to type it in. 
I set two lights for different times on and off for two weeks (not random or I would have used that). 
I had to type in FIFTY SIX titles in the rules. 
I spent plenty on other brands of smart plugs. Don’t waste your time and money. Wemo works. App is user friendly, except for above. All good.....so far.

title: Wemo socket device
text:
I bought this for my daughter so that she could turn lights on and not enter a dark apartment in Chicago. It was impossible to set up, so I bought her an IHome socket device that worked right out of the box.  
I took the Wemo home and after some time I got it to work. I have also been successful in linking it to my google assistant so that I can use voice commands to operate it. 

It is difficult to set up, but once you master it, other options are manageable.

title: Great when it works
text:
The Weno app itself is not bad. However, Wemo devices and Wemo enabled devices are flaky. They often disconnect from the network for no apparent reason, even when you have excellent network coverage. They need to be reset 2-3 times a month. If you can live with that then the whole system works fairly well.

That said, can’t help think that Wemo’s technology is little under engineered, even kind still in beta. 

Not for the average consumer—likely will end up being an exercise in frustration for many.

title: I love the simplicity, but…
text: I had a very bizarre setup experience. No matter how many times I tried, I could not get the device to connect to my wifi. Finally, when I was trying it with the "Save wifi settings" turned off, it started telling me to retry my password, and the WiFi password was always missing the last digit, no matter how many times I entered it. What ended up working was adding a digit to the end of my password, in other words entering a wing password. Then it connected and I haven't had any issues.

title: Hot garbage that work sometimes
text: I used to think was buggy because it was new. I used to think their app was just OK but would improve in time. Many years later I can tell you that we only is a buggy platform with a bad buggy app and there is no hope. If you want devices that randomly rename themselves or pick up strange rules from someone else’s app with no way to fix it… this is the platform for you. I get the feeling that the backend is 30 servers that don’t talk to eachother held together with bubblegum and toothpicks.

title: Going downhill fast
text: Been using Wemos for about 10 years.  Light switches, outlets, you name it.   About 2 years ago with Apple Home “easy” setup...it has become a NIGHTMARE.   Half of the new outlets I buy take hours to set up, if ever. I hard reset them, I reinstall the Wemo app, I skip the scanning process and type in the 8 digits.   It’s so random and frustrating and used to be pretty painless.  The app actually used to step you through the process to jump out to Wi-Fi and find the “Wemo outlet 123” to connect to. Now this “smart” installation has zero instructions and it JUST DOESN’T WORK.   Longtime customer looking to jump ship.

title: Each update makes it worse
text: Loved it to start but not any more don’t buy wemo!!! every update causes problems.  Now I have switches that don’t connect to my network, won’t reset and can’t get them to reconnect.  Which means I can’t remotely control or use with google home.  The WiFi connection also remains open and unsecured. ( not a good thing) About to disconnect and put in a $3 regular switch it’s about as useful.  You also having to frequently log in to the app because the app doesn’t remember you which isn’t helping.  I now wish I went with other remote switch company.

title: App doesn’t launch/function
text:
I’ve not managed to get the app (recently updated) to launch in about a week now. My devices turn on and off as scheduled, still, but I can’t access them via the app to manually turn them on/off. Prior to the app just not working, I was having major issues with my devices not being detected or not turning on/off when prompted through the app. This was going on for months. 

This feels like what the early version of dial-up Internet felt like. A lot of waiting and no or poor connection. These devices are a huge waste of money if  the app doesn’t function or connect to them.

title: Eventually Does it’s Job I guess
text: I open the app and try to turn a light on - Wemo switches. Click it, nothing happens. Click again, app freezes. App unfreezes, the buttons all turn yellow. Then all the devices show disconnected. Aside: the problem is not my WiFi as every other device works and connects fine. Then I wait 45 seconds - long enough to have gotten up and manually turned on the lamp at least three times - and the button shows again. Finally I click it and the lamp comes on. This is not how quality products are meant to behave.

title: WEMO
text: Use this app for my vacation home switches and light switches. Allows me to turn lights on and off, reset power to different items. Only thing I don’t care for about the app is it only allows you to control devices at one location on one portable device. In other words I can’t control the devices at my vacation home and my home from the same app on my cell phone. I have to control my home devices from the app that is installed my tablet.

title: Borderline garbage app
text:
I've been using a Wemo smart plug (2 of them actually) for over 3 years-- so I have plenty of experience struggling with these things. 

The Good:
When everything works and is set up, it works

The Bad:
So many irritating things about this product. 
1. Very slow to do anything 
2. App frequently crashes
3. Very slow
4. Not reliable
5. Very slow
6. Setting up can take a very long time and crashes are not uncommon. 
7. I'd categorize this app as "wrestle-ware" as it seems like I'm wrestling with it far too often. 
8. App sometimes needs to be deleted and re-installed to get things working again. 

I haven't tried any other wifi wall plugs, so maybe they're all this clunky, but if so, it sure isn't a very nice experience. 

I recently got an ELP Bluetooth wall switch and it works perfectly- and it's fast (and costs $14). But it's Bluetooth only, so no remote access (which I don't need).

title: Used to be good...
text:
I don’t leave a lot of app reviews, but this system has somehow gotten so bad I can’t not leave a review. Have had three plug in switches for a few years (some new, some old) and I just moved so needed to connect them a new network/router. Seems like a basic and easy action, but I’ve spent the last 45 minutes trying to do it unsuccessfully. I’ve been using these switches for an extended period of time so it’s not like I don’t know what I doing. Seems like the issue is with the app. Keeps
 crashing on my iPhone 8+. Just from a functionality standpoint I literally want to throw these things in the trash right now. Unbelievable.

title: They Work Sometimes!
text: I bought the smart outlet switch about a year ago and it worked flawlessly. Now, I’ve had issues with the app being unresponsive, the outlet loosing connection to my router (router is 20 feet from it) and in the app it saying not detected. I’m not sure what’s happening, I’ve emailed WeMo / Belkin and got no help. The email sent back said thanks for letting us know what’s going, if you have questions look at the forums. Right... So I did, and apparently this is a big problem with their products. This is why they get a 2 Star after using their product for about a year.

title: Get something else
text:
My Wemo Mini was working great until our electric went out. When the electric came back up I had to do a factory reset on the Mini. I can turn on the lamp I have attached to it via the iPhone app but the Scheduling no longer works. As suggested I deleted the app from my phone and reinstalled it.  Didn’t work.  Deleted the Schedule and reentered it. Still dies not work. Terrible!

If you don’t need Scheduling I guess it works fine but I bought the Wemo Mini specifically to schedule my lamp.  Frustrating and disappointing!

title: Unreliable at best
text:
When they work, it is a good device. But they are very unreliable, very difficult to set up. I have four, and all worked for a while, but after turning the programs off for a few months, I had to reset every one and was only able to get three of them to connect. The fourth is no longer recognized and I reset it several times, spent more than an hour trying to get it to connect.
I will not recommend WEMO to anyone and am currently looking for an easier more reliable system.

title: Great devices
text: I use 2outket controllers and one switch controller. The lamps are set to turn off and on at various times of the evening and I can easily change the schedule manually or by the program. The switch controller handles the heating cables on the roof. I can turn these off and on from anywhere in the world.  A camera tells me when it’s snowing if I’m not home.

title: Never  seems to work
text: I guess spending minutes trying to get Wemo to connect  is part of the charm.  But really it saves time to just walk over and turn on the light.  Then there’s all the times you’re logged out.  You have to remember your 10 character password.  Thats 1 character longer than what i want to use, but they required 10.  So i can  never remember the password and have to reset.   I could write write it down, but thats not secure.  I finally pull them out since it quicker just turn on the light than to deal with their glitchy software.

title: What’s up with the app?
text: I’ve been using the Wemo app for about 4 years now and I’ve never had issues with it aside from the occasional inability to connect with my smart switches. But for the past 3 days now the app is asking me to either create an account or login. So when I try to login it tells me that I must set up an account. I already have an account. Then other times it will let me login but it just sits there and spins. I’ve never had this issue, or had to login, until the past few days. Please fix this!

title: It used to work...
text: It used to work, but since the 1.25 update and the requirement for an account I cannot connect my plugs. Called support and after going through all the usual steps of clearing data, uninstall/reinstall, rebooting phone, and factory resetting device the only option they gave was to create ANOTHER account. I can’t even delete my current Wemo account in the app, just keeps giving me an error. Wemo is a subsidiary of Belkin, which generates half a billion dollars a year in revenue, and this is the best they can do? What a joke.

title: Easy setup
text: I am pleasently surprised at how easy this was to set up and how nice it is in the dark of winter not to have to come home to a dark house.   I used it this afternoon to turn the lamp on when I was at my daughters house across town.   I will be buying more.   I love the feature to be able to set up lights to come on when I am away so it looks like we are home.

title: Buggy buggy and buggy
text: This software is filled with abends and bugs. After hours on the phone with technical support (30 minute waits were commonplace) they can’t explain why their systems are so unpredictable.  Connecting and setting up the devices should be easy, but the software frequently stalls on setup and we had to reset devices and phones multiple times to get a second device online. Now, I’m out of town and it cannot connect from iPhone 8 (iOS 12.2) to either of the two devices via WiFi or cellular data. Alpha level software at best. Poor performance, Belkin.  I’m looking for something better.

title: Easy set up and it works.
text: Set up was simple. Followed the instructions. The Wemo mini updated it’s firmware. I integrated it with the Apple home system. All working as advertised. I even set it up a skill in the Alexa dot that has been banished to a remote part of the house for bad behavior (the loft!). There should be an Alexa command "Alexa, speak only when you’ve been spoken to". HomePod Siri is much more courteous. Anyway, wemo works fine with Alexa too.

title: Switch is great, app not so much
text: I am an amputee and have to get around in a wheelchair. It is a production to transfer from my chair to turn something on and off. The WEMO Switches have been a Godsend. I have them set up on Alexa which works great. Only downside is the Alexa verbal response so I use the WEMO app. It doesn’t always respond right away and sometimes screens other than the device screen come up when all I want to do is turn on the light or the fan. I also haven’t been able to list the devices in the order I want.

title: Won’t work in more than 1 location!!!
text: I live in two separate locations. I got this Wemo mini for the first location, and it worked beautifully! So I thought I could get it for the second location as well — after I got it, I called Wemo support, and that’s when I found out the Wemo app does not allow control of multiple Wemo Devices from multiple locations! So now I have to return the second one, and go with one of Wemo’s competitors — a real design flaw

title: Easy setup
text: The app works fine and does everything it’s supposed to do.  I’m not a tech wiz and I still found it pretty straight forward.  Where I had some trouble was connecting it to Alexa and getting it to respond to voice commands.  But after tinkering and trial and error I got that figured out also.  Overall I’m very pleased so far.  Next I might add cameras but the only ones available are indoor only.

title: Extremely easy to use
text:
Plug them in and the app on your phone does the work. 
If there is one downside, it would be that they don’t resume to power on after a power failure. During a storm, if the power flickers, they go out. When I’m not home I have to login remotely to turn them back on. But other than that minor nuisance, they’re great!

title: Constant “firmware” updates log you out of the app
text:
This app works fine when you’re logged in, but Wemo does firmware updates multiple times a month. It logs me out of the app anytime an update occurs, and sometimes when an update hasn’t occurred. Then I have to find my password if I want to turn on my sound machine and go to bed. Sometimes the app forgets my device because of the update. Then I have to dig for the plug and try to reset it. This happens sometimes as often as every few days. 
I’m sick of the “firmware updates” that get in the way of using the product.

title: Bad app worse devices
text:
The point of smart devices a to make life easier not force you to spend 10’s of hours per year per device resetting it up so it’s usable again.  
I own smart switches, and smart plugs from wemo (Belkin). None of them work properly and ALL of them require tons of time to monkey around with and keep operating. 
I could give you many specifics but you get the point. If you think you know better go ahead and purchase a bunch f this garbage but if you value your time at all you will soon regret it.

title: Great Concept, but.....
text:
Great concept, but needs work.

I have 15 devices to manage lights all over my house. When it works it is very nice. I just wish it was easier for a guest to operate a light without the app.

Most times only one third of my devices are ‘found’ in the app. Interestingly, the ones typically ‘not detected’ are closer to my router. I have tried to email or Live Chat, but that option is not available for Wemo. I mjust call in which is always a painful and lengthy process

title: Constant issues
text: Nice idea. Convenient when it works. Waste time with the app. Constantly shut down on me when trying to edit or change the “rules” . Yes, I have an account. Yes, I have the latest download. Yes, I’ve deleted the app and started over (multiple times). Multiple issues; Tried to log in and said it didn’t recognize my email or password. Had an account prior. All of a sudden my account is no longer and I have to start a new account, although all my devices are linked. Won’t buy again.

title: Nothing but problems, waste of time
text:
I’ve had nothing but problems with the 6 wemo mini switches I have.  Every once in a while they stop working and it takes hours performing the same setup steps over and over and over and over and over and over again after which they eventually seem setup.  However this last time they no longer show up in HomeKit.  Also the app buttons to factory reset are always grayed out even though I am on the same 2.4ghz WiFi.

This is a horrible app and product, I cannot recommend this less to anyone.

title: Ok but needs improvement
text:
Went to add a new smart plug today, which would be my third Wemo plug for home.
Well, after setting up my other two existing plugs went offline and took me about an hour to get them restored. Then my new plug took on credentials of one of the other existing plugs. It was just a mess and hassle, all I wanted to do was add my new smart plug and ended up having to reinstall all my plugs.
Pain in the backside

title: Erratic
text: First, it’s hard to sync. Once you get both plugs working, fantastic until wemo app start it’s crazy by unable to connect to internet/cloud, even after restarting my iPhone, and this is the only option from my research on the web after attempting to try all above steps. Now it’s better to fall back on the good old setup timer.

title: Wemo wall switches and mini plugs
text: I have used Wemo devices for several years, I really enjoy what they are capable of doing. I love the timer feature that allows switches to come on just before sunset and off whenever. No need to every worry about DST. I do have problems connecting to the WEMO device via weak wifi signal but am able to control my devices via my Alexa app. Why Alexa can see them and Wemo app can’t is a mistery.

title: Wemo not reliable!
text: I have used WEMO on and off for years and it has always been unreliable. We couldn’t find our traditional lamp timer before we went on vacation so I decided to give WEMO another try and started from scratch. Updated the app, setup a new account, verified my account with the email notification,  setup my plug and lamp and all worked fine. So now I’m down at the beach and the app won’t open with my new account. Verified the email for my account, even did forgot password, it says error like it has never seen my email address before. Final straw. No more WEMO for me!

title: Useful App, But Time Won't Sync
text: This app is very useful for controlling our house fan remotely. The wifi and cellular interface are easy to use and function well. My only issue is that the recurring timers I have set up execute two hours after the time I set them for (for example, I have a timer set to turn on our fan at 5 pm and the fan doesn't turn on until 7 pm). I have explored all the app's settings and cannot find a feature that allows me to correct this error. I now just set my timers two hours early.

title: It keeps getting worse
text:
I bought a switch with three bulbs a couple years ago and I was pleased from the outset, but over time the app has gone downhill. I finally called tech support last weekend, spent over an hour trying to fix things, and ended up deleting the app from my phone and loading it on my wife’s phone...but it’s still screwy. 

On my phone I could only program the lights for six days of the week, couldn’t even get the lights to come on and go off at a set time every day. These are basic functions that formerly worked but don’t anymore. 

Today I ordered the Phillips Hue starter kit. I’m starting over.

title: Can’t use at all without giving email
text:
The app requires making an account and giving an email... that seems sketchy.  They did have a link “why we need your email” and it took me to a page that says “page not found”, which made me even more uncomfortable.  I’ve been using this light switch for a while and now I can’t use my product without giving my email? 

I guess I will just use it as a normal light from now on.  I just hope they don’t make you have an email for that too.

title: I’m hooked
text: Awesome app and product. I’ve installed/setup over 25 switches, I’m not an electrician and I’m proud to say they were very easy to install with the clear and concise instructions that came with the items. I’m enjoying the remote access and the scheduling. Called customer service twice and received prompt service. The representative was knowledgeable and very professional.

title: Set up not easy as they say
text: Attempt to set it up just didn’t work.  Had to delete app and turn phone completely off to finally get it to set up mode.  Get it set up after several nights of trying to get things to work. It’s set up and lights up to indicate ready to go. Even finally showed up on iPhone as a detected device. Plug in Christmas tree lights and try to get it to turn off/on.  NO GO!!! So frustrated.  I have another Wemo smart plug and it works fine. Couple of times had to reprogram and it was wonky then too. But was able to get it to work. This one. No GO!!!

title: WeMo was amazing but is Garbage now. constantly crashing
text: We have been Wemo users / owners since they came out with the plugs and have dealt with their shortcomings but lately they are just plain awfull. All of our switches constantly disconnect and need to be reconnected to WiFi. We now are trying to add all the switches again and the app continuously crashes after entering network password. What a Joke and Junk. Don’t waste your time or money with this stuff. You will be let down and be forever forced to purchase new equipment. AWFUL! We are uninstalling the 7 switches as we speak. BYE WEMO JUNK!!!

title: App crashes constantly when setting up devices
text:
I purchased two Wemo switches and setting them up was a complete disaster.

When you are on the WiFi password screen I switched apps to go get/copy the password. When I switch back to the wemo app the entire process started back at the beginning (naming the device). This made it impossible to connect using a strong WiFi password.

Despite the horrible experience above the app crashes constantly while setting up he device

title: Don’t want WEMO accessing my home data
text: I’ve been using a couple WEMO devices for a few years now with few complaints. That is, until a recent update which has the app requesting access to my home data. That would be okay if the app would take “No” for an answer every time it pops a dialogue box asking if I will allow this, but it does not. Frankly, if this persists I’m going to chuck both of my WEMO units into the Fox River. (Kidding of course. I’d look into a responsible way to recycle them so they don’t end up in a landfill.)

title: Homekit and wemo
text: I was super pleased with the reliability of my Wemo setup. Running multiple switches and plugs it never let me down... that is until I added homekit. Now the devices drop off the network constantly, I am usually resetting two switches a week. The devices are almost always offline when I am off on my local network. Controlling the devices with Siri is a joke. It works about 50% of the time. Most of my home is automated and Wemo was the product I relied on when I needed dependability. Please help fix this issue!

title: This cut my electric bill in half!!!
text: My back room with attached bath is extra cold in the winter so we bought a space heater to help keep warm.  Before Wemo the heater stayed on 24-7, but now we can program it to come on a few hours before it's time to get ready in the morning.  When I compared my electric bill from the prior year I was excited!!! $100 less all thanks to this amazing device!  I'm in love!

title: Worked for a few month, now it won’t
text: First, it took several attempts to get my three wall outlets to get detected.  It worked fine with my IPod, then one day they all quit responding.  I have tried all the suggestions of resetting the devices, deleting the app and downloading it again.  Nothing works and I can’t get app to find them, therefore they will not show on the app.  Now my lights are no longer on a timer and the only they work is by pressing the button to turn them on and off.  Find a better device that will work more than a few months.

title: very convenient
text: so far just started to use these two plug outlets. I really appreciate that you can add timer to when turn on an off. Hope my products don’t get bugs or glitches like other people I read comments. There was update right away for each plug stating improvements for bugs & glitches.

title: Finding devices is hit and miss
text: I have some of the Wemo power outlet switches and run them through Apple home automation. Updating the devices through the Wemo app ist a total hit and miss. Somethings the app finds the devices sometimes not. Sometimes it finds available updates and sometimes not. And now the latest and greatest features is that you have to have a Wemo account even to do FW upgrades. That’s ridiculous, you buy a $15 device and then after you have it you have to create an account to continue using it .... I’m done with Wemo for good, will get other devices.

title: Keep looking
text:
System often forgets devices for several days. Not a quality way to reset the system so they’re detected. Rules are not intuitive to set up... sometimes one rule can be written for both on and off. Other times separate rules are necessary. Tutorials are limited to only a very few devices. You’re on your own for help unless you join a “community”.
Though when they’re working it’s a good system. I’d change systems if I didn’t have so much invested. I want a three way switch with dimming.

title: Very Unstable
text: The app’s connectivity with the switches is incredibly unstable for me. Every time I open the app you never know which switches the app will detect. Sometimes all of them will be detected. Other times it’s a partial list or none at all. For all practical purposes the app is useless. The switches themselves work fine and keep to their schedules.  I could pay much less for a basic in wall timer switch. Even if I go around and reset all the switches I’ll be back to the same instability in a day or two. I have a strong WiFi connection throughout the house. Very disappointed..

title: Worst smart home experience
text:
I own many smart devices, ranging from Phillips Hue to IKEA Tradfri lights, Chromecasts, Logitech Harmony, etc. The entire gamut. 

Without fail, WEMO makes the most flakey, least usable products I’ve encountered. Across three different iOS devices I have been entirely unable to get not one, not two, but three different smart plugs to function at all. I am in an endless loop of being told to connect to the device’s WiFi, and then waiting until it times out with no result whatsoever. Oh, and the newer ones endlessly badger me about being Home devices every time I try to connect, which might be nice, if Home could FIND THE DANG THINGS!

It’s infuriating and ridiculous. No other smart device I own has such a clunky, error-prone system. Even IKEA’s products are easier to set up (by which I mean, it’s at least possible to set them up). 

I would never recommend this app or any devices made by WEMO.

title: Wemo
text: This has been a lifesaver.  Being able to schedule it has been great.  Even after the tuner runs it turn you can still turn it back on if needed. I’ve come back from the hospital late at night and having wemo available has been terrific. No more coming home to an empty house.  I turn it on from my phone app from my car!! Can’t wait to buy more

title: Please add “all on” and “all off” buttons
text: I haven’t had any problems with the app or switches.  The only annoying thing is that i have to tap every “switch” on my phone screen to turn all the lights on or off. Even better, being able to put the switches into groups would allow me to turn on / off all lights, or only light upstairs or outside, etc

title: Terrible
text: I’ve purchased three WeMo switched (2 dimmers and 1 switch) m over the last year or so.  Each purchase was a bigger mistake than the last, as these products are absolutely terrible. The app almost never works, and it’s been a headache every time I’ve set a new one up.   Once set up on my phone, I then get to repeat the process to get them to show up on my wife’s phone. The concept is great, and if they were any bit reliable or easy to set up, they’d be great. However, they are not. Save your sanity and get z-wave switches or some other technology with a working reliable app. Also, no widget is yet another negative.

title: If you want to test your patience, get this app!
text: I've been using smart things around the house for years now, I'm very tech savvy and this might probably be the worst, harder to use, non responding app that I've ever downloaded in my phone! If I didn't have made the investment years ago on these wemo products I would have never bother with them. There are far superior, easier to use devices out there, just do yourself a favor and research before dropping your hard work dollars into wemo smart bulbs. Can't say much about other products they offer the the bulbs are garbage and the app doesn't make things any easier.

title: Good thought. Just need to update
text:
Initially wouldn’t set up right. Uninstalled app several times and reinstalled. Finally after a device firmware update app paired to device properly. 

The issue now is the status of the device (on/off) in the wemo app is inaccurate. Sometimes when you toggle it on, it stays off, and vise Versa. I have to tap on/off a few times (2-3) and it toggles power. Works great if you can see the device, but not if you are somewhere else. Close, just fix this and I will be 4.5 star happy.

title: When they work, they are great.
text: I was very excited to get these. Setup was not easy. I have finally figured out that they have a difficult time keeping their WiFi signal. I have Xfinity’s fastest internet service in a 1200 sqft apartment; not very big. My modem is in one room, two of these plugs in the next room; I can see the modem while looking at this plug. The plug constantly loses its connection. I am getting a satellite for the the modem and hopefully that fixes the issue.

title: Simple to use
text:
Great!  Replaced my front yard sprinkler timer with a Wemo plug. I just plugged the transformer right into the Wemo and the other end to the automatic sprinkler. 

Much easier to use than the old rainbird  timer.  I set up a schedule for the wemo plug and I can operate it easily from my iPad.

Otherwise the schedule just takes over and waters the same old way.

title: Glitches
text: The app frequently will not execute on the first finger tap, but requires closing, then reopening before it will work. There have been some unexplained hardware glitches, as when, for no discernible reason, the switch needs to be re-activated, which is a pain. It has happened enough so that I keep the pass codes written down near the switches. But it works well a large part of the time.

title: ZERO ZERO ZERO!!!!!
text: I had a lot of hope for this product because of it ability to sync with Apple HomeKit and the supposed easy set up that the manual sold me on. However, I ended up disappointed when I plugged in the switch, downloaded the app and have the app and my dreams crash in a matter of seconds. The device and phone are feet away from my router so connectivity isn’t a problem. It just the app crashes upon set up. The enhancements the description says the company made to the app didn’t help at all. Please fix for future customers don’t have the same issue. Sincerely, a frustrated and now former customer.

title: Firmware Server
text: I like the Wemo connectivity to internet but my device would not connect due to either a server issue and or firmware update I could not receive from my other location. The switches would not nd could not be turned on remotely. Worked fine when I was at the location of the switch and could do a firmware update. Totally defeated the purpose I installed the switch. Will try again but if it fails I will go to a Honeywell switch with timer not connected to internet

title: Disappointing
text:
I like the idea.  Set up was easy but to program the lights for sunrise/sunset is impossible.  What a joke.  On and off seem to switch positions almost at random .    I guess i will just have to manually turn the lights on and off.   Great idea , but get the app intuitive before you dump this crap on the public

Update ;  purchased another one for another property.  Complete plié of junk.    Would not connect.  Kept resetting. Had to return for refund.  Don't wast your time or money.  If you do, keep your receipt .  Chances are you will be going back for refund.

title: WeMo Light switches and outlets
text: It’s too bad that these are so undependable. They seem to have a mind of their own. I am getting tired of physically resetting each unit at the source. I will be replacing these with a better quality and more expensive product. Believe me, it will be well worth the frustration of not being able to control your lighting. I’ve been doing this for three years!

title: Waste of time and money
text: If you enjoy reconfiguring your smart home devices multiple times a week then look no further, this is the product/software for you. While my Phillips smart home devices, google home, Alexa, and streaming devices all maintain a constant connection to wifi Wemo has proven to be as unreliable as they are reliable. I have nothing positive to say about their product, software, or support. They have been nothing but a complete waste of time and money. The only joy I have received from this company came from destroying the wemo product with a hammer and deleting the app from from my devices.

title: Not easy to set up or reset
text:
I’m moderately tech savvy. This device has wonderful conveniences like remote usage, schedules, and connection to my Google Home for voice command. However, it takes 15-30 minutes to set up and it is very manual. There is a separate network to connect to, then a switch back to your home network. I suggest you find a video tutorial to assist with set up- and lots of patience. 
3 stars because of difficulty in set up.

title: Works for me
text: We have only one light switch connected now but planning to get more. I love to be able to control the light through Wemo without getting up from bed. It did get disconnected once and we had to reset the whole thing, but got it back and happy with it. I set the sleep timer and the lights go off, pleasure of comfort

title: In general not bad
text:
We have 1/2 of our switches as Wemo for 4 years and they are reliable. Only problem is rules do not work well. We established 2 particular switches to turn on and off at scheduled time. Only works for few days, then you need to reschedule. After few times we just gave up. 
With that exception brand is very good. 
Customer service helped a lot in the beginning.

title: Closing these servers too??
text:
I hope your company isn’t planning on dumping the server that supports these products too, like you did with your IP Cameras. What a waste of my money!

I purchased 6 of your IP cameras, never thinking you’d trash the entire camera line, leaving us consumers who trusted you & your products! Foolish Consumer! 

Now I have a bunch of useless cameras. Are you going to dump your WiFi sockets & light switches?? Should I start replacing them NOW?  You should have arranged to keep the servers going, or made a software update to allow us to connect to other servers, with more responsible companies!

title: Pure garbage
text:
These devices are useless. I have several (shame on me) and they are CONSTANTLY going offline. There is never a day goes by that they actually work like they claim they will. When they go down, which they will, you’re lucky if all you have to do is power cycle them 1 to 5 times. If not? You’re told to reset them back to factory. Good luck with that. I also had to do the recently. Spent literally DAYS trying to get this worthless trash to reconnect. Tech support is just as worthless. 

Save yourself time and money and stay far away from anything Wemo.

title: What happened Wemo?
text:
A few years ago this was a very convenient app and product. I even wrote a 4 star review.  Now when I open the app to switch on a light, I get “not detected” messages for 20 seconds. Kinda defeats the whole idea. I can walk to the switch in far less time. 
Twice in the last year several switches went continuously “not detected” forcing me to reboot them.  Each time it was different switches. And the connect time got worse and worse. 
If you are reading this do not buy the Wemo products. Try the Kasa switch. Wemo will surely disappoint you.

title: Somwthing has gone wrong
text: For the first year the mini switches have worked flawless, the rules work great, they picked up my WiFi no problem.  Since the update of 1.22 and 1.24 things have gone wrong.   I have turned the rules off but the device still acts on them.  The app takes forever to load and the devices are mostly undetected now. Nothing has changed with the device placement or my WiFi so I’m assuming it is issues with the app and update... currently looking for other brands similar..

title: Spent so much and stuck with an app that doesn’t work
text: I had five dimmer switches and one on/off switch installed. They were installed and set up via the Wemo app but do not appear in the Wemo app once set up (only the ever present “looking for devices”). The Alexa app can find them but several are constantly “unresponsive” so I can only control them manually at the switch plate. I feel that I’ve wasted so much money going with a brand that was slightly less expensive to purchase but will be incredibly expensive to have removed and replaced with a more reliable brand.

title: Costco deal on mini plugs - do not update firmware
text:
I connected with one plug and like a good do bee, updated the firmware.  BAD MOVE.  That plug consistently now loses connection and set ups are almost impossible.  I also watched every You Tube video and read tech guidance.  It is a bad sign when one simple piece of hardware has ten videos on the same problem.  It just will not connect or stay connected to local Wifi.
I then used second plug, disregarding any instruction to update firmware and it has worked fine.  Since the problem is the firmware in first plug, no hardware reset will do anything.  It is a wasted piece of plastic.

NO FIRMWARE UPDATES

While I would say the concept of this product is great and you would think that after this many years both the app and the actual device would work without as many problems as I have read about or experienced for myself. The app doesn’t find my Wemo switch and doesn’t usually stay sync with my google home app. Just recently I experienced the lights shutting off on their own. I’m tech savvy and checked for updates and made sure my WiFi was working properly but even still it doesn’t work.

title: It’s fine… Apple Home is the Problem
text: Many folks are having bad experiences with these devices or with the WeMo app. For me personally, the smart plugs and the WeMo app work fine — it’s the Apple Home app that is awful. Apple Home continually says “updating” and loses connection with the smart plugs. However, the WeMo app itself is always fine and the outlets themselves work as expected. Apple, please fix your home automation app.

title: Getting lazy
text:
These things are great no more getting up and turning the lights on just say it to one of echo dots and turn the light on or turn the light off. You can also set schedules for your lights to come on and go off by themselves through the app.
They need to fix their app has not been working ever since the new update

title: Inconsistent
text: The outlet worked well for a while but it flakes out from time to time and when it does, fixing it is horrible. If it loses connection, I often have to make the app forget the device and re-add it. Even then, that procedure works only 50/50. The last time it happened, I tried to re-add it and I couldn’t. A couple of weeks later, I re-added it again and the app count it and it’s working through the app but it’s no longer controllable via Alexa. I own several other brands of smart outlets and will never buy another one of these.

title: TERRIBLE!
text: This app and BELKIN aka Wemo cannot fix a serious bug with this app and it’s devices.  The app has been stuck in “upgrading firmware” for two months at least BUT the product it’s supposedly updating is not even plugged in anywhere.  BELKIN/LINKSYS/WEMO claims they have no fix and no idea if or when one is coming.  Lately this companies wheels have totally fallen off the bus. Dozens of wasted hours with tech support each time and no fix!  Beware.  Issues with HomeKit.  Apple - stop selling these products when they are not working - do more to crack down on broken links to HomeKit. It’s embarrassing.  FIX IT

title: Horrible First Impression
text: I just got the Wemo Mini after hearing good things from a friend. I am following the instructions and downloaded the app. I try to create an account and I am able to enter my email, create a password, but when I go to enter my name, the app times out and says an error occurred. I tried deleting the app and reinstalling. I tried it on my iPad as well with no success. Completely unacceptable and what a terrible first impression. Going to return the three Wemo Minis I bought and look at a different brand. Don’t waste your money on this product with a horrendous app.

title: App never works
text: The app almost never works for controlling my Wemo devices. Luckily I have it synced to google home, so I can tell it to turn my lights that way, but almost any time I try to use the app it says that my device “cannot connect to the wemo cloud.” I have the latest updates, my internet connection is totally fine, and I’ve tried restarting several times. I have no problems with my other apps, so it must be an issue with connection to wemo cloud. I will definitely go with a different smart plug next time because this app is not dependable.

title: Firmware updates are broken
text: The latest app update broke a lot of things, but the one that still hasn’t resolved is that it’s stuck constantly trying to update device firmware. Sometimes it seems to have worked, only to lose the devices and restart downloading the update. I’ve reinstalled several times to try to fix it, and the devices work fine, but the Home app is constantly bugging me to update via the WeMo app, which doesn’t work. Ruined a perfectly fine set it and forget it device with a super buggy app update.

title: All products
text:
Connectivity relies on an excellent WiFi signal,
and don’t get in a rush, even if you have to contact 
“Support” for connection problems. It’s a process.
I love the features, especially being able to control time schedules when I am 1750miles distant from home.
(and use caution if you upgrade your router, you will spend hours on the phone to enable your devices)

title: Used to be able to control regardless of internet or cloud status.
text: I used to be able to control my WeMo device on my local network, regardless of what the outside world dictated - internet outage, server outages etc. Currently, it seems in a recent update that belkin has changed the app and requires a connection to the WeMo cloud before you’re even able to access local devices right in your house. The problem is, if your internet is down or the WeMo cloud is down, you’re not allowed to control your own local devices. Absolute shame.

title: Stopped working
text: Been using the Wemo light switches and outlet since they came out. Functionality was good for about 80% of the time so was not too bad. Now with this latest update they introduced accounts to keep things safer. I delayed in creating the account was was fine, this morning I said why not, now I can’t control any of my devices remotely, just a spinning wheel and this happened after I created an account. Now I need to replace all the wemo switches I have, I guess it will lead me to getting something compatible with HomeKit without having to buy a separate module.

title: Lasted update broke my system
text:
Simple.
Please don’t release an app the needs an unavailable firmware update to function. 
I have two mini smart plugs that were flawless until the last update. I have the Wemo bridge for HomeKit. Worked great. After the update I can’t get the devices to be recognized in home kit. I reset reinstalled all the usual stuff. The work from the Wemo app but no longer in HomeKit. Hope that firmware update is any day now. 
I know Apple is a difficult beast but keeping existing and paying customers should be the top priority. What about the money I just spent on the bridge? Now obsolete in several months? Unacceptable.

title: Bad Belkin product getting worst
text: I have 10+ Wemo Switches for over 3 yrs, the app response and ability to connect to manage devices is very poor/frustrating, 3 yrs after my first purchase and the service has degraded even more.  The “not detected” is so frequent in the App that doesn’t surprise me anymore.  Even by Alexa, is the ONLY device that frequently shows up as “device is unresponsive”.  I am replacing them with Kasa, and I have not had any issues at all since day one.  I’ll be glad to be out of Wemo in less than a year.  I can’t recommend Belkin products.

title: Purchased 10 wemo light switches and will never buy again
text:
Setup first light switch, app recognized device without issue.  Setup 2nd switch in the same manner, but app can’t detect it no matter what, reset wifi, factory reset, turn on/off breaker. Wifi config went fine but device can’t be detected (maybe bad device)… tried 3rd, same thing as 2nd switch (another bad switch?) tried 4th, same thing.  No matter what you do, app can’t find it , all the app sees is the 1st switch. Waste of money and app keeps acting up when adding devices.
(Can’t give 0 star).

title: Easy setup
text: So far, I’ve bought several of the smart plugs, and they are really easy to set up. The only complaint I have about the app is if I don’t use it for a while, it makes me log back in and there is no Face ID option. For some reason iOS is suggesting email addresses for the login that aren’t the correct one, and I have to look it up each time.

title: Junk
text: works great until you unplug the outlet or the power goes out it seems like well actually every single time we’ve had a power outage it takes a whole long time to reprogram this thing and get it set back up all the other lights and switches they all just come right back on no problem don’t have to do anything to them I can’t understand why this thing there works and then when I finally get it synced up he wants to do a download of the new firmware hope they get it right All my other lights and switches work just fine!

title: It just keeps getting worse and worse with every new build
text:
Today is the first time since late July trying to log in. And I can’t even log in anymore. I ask for a password reset and an hour and a half has gone by and still no reset email. Tried all reasonable means to solving this but nothing works. I reach out to Belkin chat support and I’m told they don’t support Wemo. They gave me a number to call. I’m on permanent-hold now for  

People! Let this be an example of what to expect from Belkin after you buy their trash. Find some other vendor - ANY OTHER BUT BELKIN!

title: This is a great system
text: Got the switch in a Home Depot markdown bin and I want to buy more.  My adult children think that switches only work to turn lights on and it is nice to see the back light on and be able to turn it off without having to walk down stairs to do it. My dad would have loved this for when I was home.

title: From 5 stars to 1. Was great. Now not
text:
Updated Review
Women now forces users to register with an online cloud account. It’s terrible. Now, instead of interacting locally with my Wemo appliances flawlessly as I could previously, I am forced to login to their cloud server. Their server is always going down, Which means I can’t turn my appliances and lights on and off with in my own home! WeWeMo has shot themselves in the foot with this cloud account foolishness. Weimer was wonderful because it was an in-home locally used app.
I will be looking for new appliances

Original Review
Everything positive you have read is true. Works flawlessly no wires, easy to set up and use. 
My only wish is that the WeMo app would show the device MAC address so I could identify them in my network management app. I get more networked devices constantly and need to identify the approved ones from those that are slowing down my network.

title: New “Live” system has locked me out of my account and devices.
text:
Last night, I got a message to create an account.  I already had an account but anyway, went through the motions, finally received the verification email to confirm email address and password and all I get now is an error message every time I try to log in.   I cannot access my account or devices through the app anymore.  Just get error messages!

I hope Alexa will keep working to turn things off and on until they fix this — if they can.

Furthermore — their is NO WAY of contacting them.  No Customer Service info, phone or email.  Thus is the only way I can contact them—hopefully.  Who knows if anyone bothers looking at these reviews.  

If this fails for much longer—fine, I’ll switch out the electric plugs with ones that continue to work and write Memo/Belkin off my list forever.

title: Don’t buy
text:
You may be tempted, but I’m telling you. Just don’t do it, don’t buy anything from this company.

You would think: oh! A wifi connected switch, what a joy! Now i can turn off anything plugged in to that switch using my phone. 

The truth is, you can’t. Not only will it take you forever to set up, no matter how tech savvy you are, it simply won’t ever work as advertised. It will tempt you, by working once in a while. But then it will just stop working.

You won’t be able to use your phone to turn it on and off, you won’t be able to turn it on and off when you’re not at home, you won’t be able to get apple’s home kit to turn it on and off, and you definitely won’t get siri or google assistant to be able to turn it on and off.

This product is awful, and now I can’t get a full refund, because I’m complaining about it a little too late.

title: Good app at the products are broken
text: One of the greatest problem with this line of products is how they are not delivering at the level that is advertised. The products are not working with HomeKit, Google home and Alexa as advertised. After two hours on the phone they could not get my Dimmer-switch working with HomeKit. My recommendation to stay away from this product until they get serious about getting their product working with their vendor partners. Other products from different corporations have worked much better.

title: Pretty good, but I hope they continue to develop
text: I was really impressed with first few switches and plugs I installed.  There was minimal trouble shooting to get them in and they worked pretty slick.   My biggest peeves:   They seem to continually reset and update, so it I can only access them part of the time.   They don’t really tell you when a firmware update is available and let you do, they just go automatically and they don’t show progress.   For style, it would be great if the dimmers matches the switches.

title: Thank god for Wemo
text: This has been the best addition to my apartment. Having a dog at home and being able to turn the light on for him has made my life a lot easier. Also if lights were left on we can just check the app and turn everything off makes life so much easier than running back in to turn everything off.

title: Great For the Blind!
text: My wife, who is blind, was gifted to have these this Christmas. We hooked them up to the TVs in our living room and, bedroom. They were a little difficult to get to connect but, after some careful configuring, they work fantastic with Alexa. We plan to buy many more for anything else that we can possibly plug in and connect. I will recommend them to everyone I know!

title: WeMo switch is not that great
text: I purchased 2 WeMo switch and they both have the same behavior. They lose connectivity to the WiFi and stop working. Had a difficult time setting them up and once I did, I was able to create rules for when they should turn on and off. At this point they work because of the rule. But if I want to turn on the outlet manually, I cannot because it cannot be found on the app. This is a big problem and Belkin should address it. Their support page does not give proper support only has issues that they identify, not the actual users. Not good.

title: Super Buggy
text:
I've been using WeMo for a couple of years now and have used different devices an different generations. Setup is super buggy, the app fails to recognize the correct status of the switch, and devices connect for no reason. The interface is slow and inconsistent. There are other options out there and WeMo is not worth your precious time or money.

Update: Worst app of all the apps. EVER! Most of my devices have stopped working completely and the app can't go 2 minutes without crashing. I've wasted so much freaking time and money throubleshooting this crap. Never again! ***DON'T BUY ANYTHING WEMO***

title: Wemo
text: It works and I'm glad to have it but the software is a little strange there's two icons for it and one of them just calls up a list of Who knows what, and doesn't do anything I had a little difficulty figuring out how to get get it to where I could use it but it is usable now and I appreciate having it so I won't stumble in the dark on my waythrough the house. Sometimes I do get the wrong icon and have to fumble with it before I get in the right place and turn the light switch on or off.  I'm glad to have it though.   I've used it daily.

title: Great product
text: I bought a Wemo mini and it took 2 minutes to set up including connecting to wifi and setting up my desired timer settings. No issues at all.  I have my Christmas tree connected and no more turning the lights on and off each day.  Highly recommend this product!

title: Very disappointing/frustrating
text: I bought these because of the price point and good reviews on third-party websites. However I’ve had nothing but trouble getting them to integrate into the Apple HomeKit. And poor Wi-Fi performance. Then they changed their account structure, and I had to set up an entire new account with a different email address reregister all of the devices and yet I’m still having problems. It could be because mine are older although I don’t know if that’s correct or not. But there are definitely better alternatives out there.

title: Wemo lost its way
text: I used to sincerely suggest Wemo as arguably the best WiFi-based smart home solution out there. That changed recently. They’re now requiring Wemo accounts to use your devices, your location to use the app, and everything has become far less reliable and zippy in terms of responsiveness. Their prices have remained high and don’t reflect this loss in quality. I’m sad about it, but I think I’m done with Wemo. No more new products for me.

title: Worthless 1/2 Star
text:
I bought two Wemo smart plugs a few months ago. Setup fairly easy and worked till we had a power outage. Simple would never find the plug again. I bought a Samsung hub and plugs to replace with. They have worked through outages, modem replacements etc. Still have the wemo plugged in, thought I would give it another try, but no go.
This is Belkin, and my router is netgear. I wonder if that is why some get it to work and other can’t. Not requiring a hub was the reason I bought it, but ended up having to buy a system with a hub. Hope they work the bugs out, could be a good product.
Jax

title: Works great
text: Bought this to control my Christmas lights. Use to use a timer, did the job but was a hassle if I wanted to turn light on and off at different times than set. With the WEMO smart plug they turn on and off automatically but with the app I can turn them on and off manually much more easily while still maintaining the auto settings.

title: Terrible terrible terrible
text: To start, I have to reset the plug every time, every time! There is no way to properly report an issue of any kind within the app. Oh certainly there is the facade to report an issue , it’s just absolutely impossible to actually do so. I have two light bulbs with a wall plug WiFi enabled set up that is supposedly compatible with my Alexa, nope . I got this small system originally because it was more affordable than many others. I wanted to see how well it integrated with my Alexa and also how easy it was to use. Does do anything well. Just seriously disappointed all around.

title: Easy and convenient
text: We love the Wemo app. Especially being able to turn the outside lights on. We’ve hooked up indoor lights and front and rear outside lights. So easy to install. We recently went on vacation and this app gave us so much peace of mind, knowing we could turn the lights on and off to give the appearance of someone being home. Definitely I recommend it.

title: WeMo App
text:
It needs work. I have 3 smart plugs. The setup ranged from simple and straight forward to more difficult (factory reset required) to considerably more difficult. The third plug required multiple factory resets, a firmware update and another reset before I could get it added to the Home App. The average person would probably have returned it.

Update. They were working and now they are not. I have tried multiple factory resets, removing them from the Home App and starting over. After too many retries they are unplugged and I am going to try a different brand.

title: “Not detected” is all I get on your app
text: I have 6 light switches and 5 plugs and for some reason this app says “not detected” on half of them even tho my alexa can still control all of them.  This company needs to spend more time on its app functionality. I had to delete the app completely just to reinstall a light switch that wasn’t working and had to reinstall. App still doesn’t recognize it as “detected” alexa does tho.  Good hardware, horrific, garbage, embarrassingly bad software. I expected better from my wemo.

title: Sporadic
text: When the App works, it works well & offers many options to control the devices, including timers, programmable on/off times, remote control from anywhere, etc., but FAR TOO OFTEN, the App won’t boot & only shows a blank green screen with a spinning ring, which grows old very quickly... Also frequently, when it finally boots, some of the devices blank out as “not detected” and therefore can’t be controlled. This sporadic behavior needs to be addressed and fixed soon.

title: Setting parameters is counterintuitive
text: I like the WeMo but the UI is not user-friendly.  I use a WeMo wall switch for an outside light and a wallplug for a lamp.  Connecting them to wifi during the setup wasn't bad but once that was done, the trouble started.  Instead of simply allowing us to set up each device as to when to turn it on or off, the interface makes you come up with individual rules which you assign to devices.  That's nuts and took me forever to figure out.  Bad UI.

title: I love these things.
text: I bought a Wemo mini switch because I wanted to be able to control one of the lamps in my room remotely after knee surgery, so I wouldn’t have to get up after getting settled. It worked perfectly, so I bought two more. The app is easy to use, and not difficult at all to set up, if you follow the instructions. I like it, and the switches.

title: All of our Wemo switches and plugs!
text: We have several switches and plugs in our home and they work perfectly. What a convenience to be able to schedule lights on and off as well as have the ability to control them remotely when we are out of town. If the kids forget to turn off a light we just access our Wemo App and all is well!

title: Belkin Is Quality!
text: All Belkin products are extremely well engineered and built to be long-term durable and reliable.  The set-up instructions are very clear.  Belkin was an early occupant of the Home Security space and many other companies are racing to catch up.  However, as this market space matures, Belkin will continue to lead due to their commitment to innovative and quality products!

title: Update is worthless
text: I’ve been waiting an update so I could add my WeMo minis since I’ve had nothing but bad luck in getting them connected and was excited to see an update today. Unfortunately it’s worthless and the app is even crashing more frequently than before. I’ve tried everything from rebooting my phone, rebooting the router, resetting the wemo device all to no avail.  Cannot for the life of me get this plug to connect. I’ve had wemo plugs for years and never encountered this much of an issue, but this has become so frustrating I’m considering unplug them all and going to another plug.

title: Belkin will last as long as you’re having them
text:
I love the Belkin smart switch because it will last as long as you have it.  Currently, I have had the switch for sometime that couldn’t remember exactly when I got it.  However, the App and firmware are available to be updated at no time. Love,
Loi

title: Plugs work with both Wemo app and Alexa
text: Everything just plain works for me. I’ve had at least one unobtrusive firmware update over a couple of years. (That’s good.) Plugs work well with Wemo app and Alexa. A couple times a month, the Alexa skill loses its mind and I fire up the Wemo app to take care of things. No problems using the current app and firmware.

title: Customer service was AMAZING
text: I NEVER (repeat never) write reviews and despite being on hold for over 15 minutes the rep solved my problem quickly and thoroughly! Couldn’t be happier. No up-sales, no talking down to me for not understanding what he said at first, just solid customer support. Will definitely shop with Wemo again!

title: Rules no longer work
text: I have had Wemo for many years. When Belkin required a sign-in, the devices stopped working and tech support got things working. Now all rules are missing when using my ipad. Rules show when using phone. If a rule is created on the ipad, it does not show on the iphone. All Wemo devices are listed. Devices turning on and off per the schedules listed on iphone is hit and miss. I worked with tech support and they elevated the case. Then I get an email saying they couldn’t reach me when I never got a call, voicemail or email.

title: Great Wemo Product
text:
Love the mini switch Wemo. I have 5 of them in place and they are working great.
The first four were extremely easy to set up, the fifth one was a little problematic but finally got it working. It may have been my internet since I have some intermittent problems with it. I will definitely purchase more to complete my other projects.

title: all the negative reviews need to think about security flaws it had earlier
text: all the negative reviews need to think about security flaws it had earlier. You need to create account and only then xan access the switches. Anyone connected to wifi could access the switches earlier. Now only account holders can access the switches thus making it more secure. Still needs lot of improvement over speed as compared kasa switches.

title: Went from good to terrible
text:
In the past two months, the Wemo app has forced registration on the user. Previously, you could use your Wemo devices and the app without being registered. The app has been pushing for registration for a while (which I avoided), but then became unusable without registration on the user end. You could not control your devices until you registered the app. Now that I have registered, I am unable to connect to my devices. 
This is business 101 for how to alienate your current customers and cause irreparable damage to your brand.

title: App can’t connect to internet when other apps can
text:
The app now says it cannot connect to the internet. But all the other apps on the iPhone can.  In addition, when trying to create an account using the app, I entered a nickname and it simply said “Error, try again.”

After multiple attempts I was able to create an account. Then the app told me that my password was incorrect.  But I just set it.  So I reset the password which looked like it worked. Then left the app, came back in and it told me my password was incorrect again.

title: App buggy - requires location services??
text:
Adding accessories has always been an issue. App consistently crashes but occasionally allows me to add an accessory. 

Biggest complaint is that the app REQUIRES location services to ALWAYS be on. I cannot even start up the app to just turn a switch on without turning location services on. 

I understand the need if users want to use the app to turn something on/off based on the user’s location but it shouldn’t be REQUIRED to use the app.

title: Wemo customer support
text: I have a Wemo LED light kit that I have been unable to set up. I was on the phone for over an hour and a half with product support but no luck. I was finally told that this issue needs to be elevated to the next level and that someone would call me back in the morning at a determined time. That was over 2 hours ago and no call. I am now back on eternal hold waiting for someone to answer...I am not getting a good feeling about this Belkin product. At this point I am frustrated and would NOT recommend any of their products.

title: Fine when it works...but constantly needing new firmware and reconnecting
text: When they work they are great. However I get an alert for new firmware every few weeks, which requires trying to reconnect each and every time. I have spent probably 2 hours talking with support staff over the many times I’ve had to reconnect the devices. The app crashes, doesn’t find my very strong WiFi signal, and then requires many times to redo it over and over. So frustrating.

title: Rules have been very unreliable
text:
We have two wemo minis with identical rules. One turns on our house Xmas lights, 30m before sunset thru 11pm. The other does the same but for our Xmas tree.

If I look in the evening I should see both on, but in the last few days I'm just as likely to see one or the other or both off. Last week they surprised us by both shutting off a few hours earlier than expected. One time the house lights didn't turn on at all by after sunset. 

I don't know what the problem is, but rules are totally unreliable.

title: Great but Inconsistent
text:
The WEMO works great as a remote controller. A suggested feature would be an in app timer clock countdown for active Wemos.  A huge gap in the system is not being able to use the same app for multiple locations. The updates tend to render the unit unusable if the update is interrupted or if you relocate the unit to a new WiFi profile and is difficult to reset and re-sink with the app. 
The app is clunky, despite a full reset there are still ghost profile settings that unexpectedly turn units on.

title: Impossible create WeMo schedules
text: Customer service was not able to fix this issue. The issue was escalated to the technical team but the issue was never solved. They said it is a problem with the app and there is nothing they can do about it. After a few months now of creating the ticket, it is still impossible to schedule anything. It is worth noting that the possibility to create schedules was one of the main arguments they advertised to sell this device.

title: Too time consuming. Not user-friendly.
text:
Each time I program a rule...have to relearn the process and then almost impossible to turn off rule.  Have used for over two years and still as confused as when first got them.

I am still having problems....neither device will stay connected to Alexa and disable and enable....works for about an hour and then Alexa no longer recognizes it.  These plug devices are a waste of time and money.  Unless someone shows me where it was my fault...That I am doing something wrong...I can only conclude it is something in the pairing of Device with Alexa.
